Title: Data Scientist
Description:
You see things a little differently. So do we! We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us.

Who we are The world is changing, and the IKEA business is changing with it. For IKEA though, one thing will always remain the same ─ our vision to create a better everyday life for the many people.

We will strengthen and develop our competencies to meet the needs and dreams of the many people around the world. And to be accessible and relevant, wherever and whenever they wish to meet IKEA.

About IKEA Insights
Insights has the assignment to contribute to IKEA people making well-founded decisions based on actionable and timely insights. Insights delivers Retail Insights, Product Range and Communication Insights, and Strategy Insights. Each of these three areas develops and/or operates insight products to IKEA people across our value chain.

As a Data Scientist, you will be part of the Data Engineering and Analytics chapter while working in a cross-functional team with one of the products within IKEA Insights.




Job Description



Being a Data Scientist in the INSIGHTS team


As a Data Scientist in the Insights team, you will be responsible for analysing large amounts of data and creating predictive models to help us understand and influence customer behaviour and preferences. You will work closely together with other Data scientists, Data engineers, Product team(s) and other stakeholders. You will be part of creating solutions that enable customers to design any space in their homes and businesses and configure home furnishing solutions digitally. Exploring and utilizing different technologies and approaches to achieve the best result is a natural part of everything you do. With your data driven mindset you are a strong ambassador and driver for the data literacy and culture in IKEA Insights.





To be successful in this role


You are passionate about using data to analyse and develop dashboards and models that help our customers find the home furnishing solutions that best fit their needs.


You bring broad knowledge of modern applied algorithms (predictive and prescriptive) for extracting insights and making decisions based on data, a strength in statistics and general analytical knowledge. You make mistakes sometimes that keep you evolving and learning as you are not afraid to find new ways to solve a challenging task together with your colleagues.

You have a great interest in the world around you and keep yourself updated with the latest trends and future technology, just as we do.



To be successful in this role, the following knowledge, skills and experiences would be valuable:


● Minimum Master's degree in statistics, physics, mathematics, econometrics, computer science or related
● Comprehensive understanding of statistical and machine learning techniques
● Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
● Proficiency with an appropriate set of languages, technologies, and frameworks (e.g., Python, PySpark, Databricks, Azure ML, ADLS, MLFlow, Github) and cloud environments (e.g. Azure)
● Proficiency with data modelling techniques and concepts, CI/CD
● Preferably minimum 5 years’ experience in equal or comparable position
● Experience from the business that the product area (data) is supporting and enabling
● Experience as a project member in agile project environments and methodologies as well as in running business activities
● Ability to collaborate with others (including virtual) such as team members, stakeholders and suppliers to achieve goals, pro-active attitude
● Ability to explain statistical and machine learning techniques to non-technical stakeholders and software engineers
● Work with technology as a business tool and translate requirements into solutions, balancing user experience, business needs and IT constraints
● Ability to understand the complexity of the IKEA business and the role of technology as an integrated part of the business





You will also:


● Facilitate the construction of transparent, reproducible, reusable and generalisable data science products and services
● Research and develop models for data analysis
● Design, develop and maintain data science models and infrastructures, for your area or product.
● Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers
● Contribute to the dissemination of methodologies, accelerators or algorithms created for specific models or analysis
● Make sure that the insights and conclusions from data science are easily available to other parts of the organisation
● Support a culture of data-driven decision making across IKEA organisations
● Continuously improve existing models and environments
● Work closely together with data engineers, architects, analysts, peers, and other relevant roles across IKEA as well as in your team
● Ensure application and consistency with relevant digital frameworks, principles, guidelines, and standards
● Document and make the operational know-how of the data science models available to the IKEA ecosystem
● Keep up to date with the latest technology trends
● Assure quality and contribute to testing of deliverables




Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields. Master’s degree is preferred within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields.
Minimum of 5+ years of experience in a similar role working in running business activities as well as in agile project environments.
Strong Communication skills. Written & verbal in English


Additional Information



This role is full-time (32 - 40 hours per week) and can be based in Delft, Netherlands. Please send us your application (CV and motivation letter in English) on or before Friday 20th September 2024.  

Please note that we always recruit based on values, competence, your potential and diversity.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Bij Olympia zijn we op zoek naar een Junior Data Scientist die ons Data team komt versterken. In deze rol draag je bij aan het ontwikkelen en implementeren van machine learning-oplossingen die vraagstukken oplossen en waarde creëren voor onze organisatie. Je werkt nauw samen met senior teamleden om data-analyses uit te voeren, machine learning-modellen te ontwikkelen, en innovatieve toepassingen te bouwen, met een speciale focus op Large Language Models (LLM).




Verder ben je verantwoordelijk voor:




Data-analyse. Je voert dataverkenning en analyse uit met behulp van Python en SQL om inzicht te krijgen in datasets.
Experimentatie en iteratie. Je voert experimenten uit om de prestaties van machine learning-modellen te verbeteren, waarbij verschillende algoritmen en technieken worden getest.
Samenwerken. Je werkt actief samen met senior data analisten en met collega’s van de vestigingen om projecten te realiseren.
Documenteren. Je documenteert processen, modellen, en resultaten om kennisdeling en reproduceerbaarheid binnen het team te bevorderen.
Cloudgebruik. Je werkt in cloudomgevingen, zoals Azure ML om modellen te trainen, te implementeren en te schalen.




Waar ga je werken?

Als je bij Olympia komt werken ga je een avontuur aan. Je sluit je aan bij een professionele uitzendorganisatie waar bij twee zaken centraal staan: ondernemerschap en impact. Je gaat werken in een gedreven, gemotiveerd en hecht team. Er is veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng.




Jouw standplaats is het Olympia Service Center (hoofdkantoor) van Olympia in Hoofddorp. Wij werken activity based en passen onze werkplek aan op onze activiteiten. Het spreekt voor zich dat (deels) vanuit huis werken tot de mogelijkheden behoort. In principe werken wij twee dagen per week op kantoor.




In de rol van Junior Data Scientist maak je deel uit van de afdeling Data bestaande uit vier collega’s. Je rapporteert aan Coen Seinen (Manager Data & Insights) en die rapporteert aan Gabriella Serreli (CDO).




Wie ben je?

Om succesvol te zijn in je rol als Junior Data Scientist ben je positief en ondernemend ingesteld en beschik je over strategisch en analytisch inzicht.




Je hebt een WO werk- en denkniveau, in de studierichting Data Science, Informatica, Wiskunde, Statistiek of een gerelateerd vakgebied.
Je hebt 0-2 jaar (stage)ervaring in een data sciene-rol.
Je hebt diepe kennis van machine learning-algoritmen en technieken.
Vaardigheid in het gebruik van Python voor data-analyse en machine learning.
Je hebt sterke analytische en probleemoplossende capaciteiten.




Wat mag je verwachten?

Een avontuur bij een top speler onder de Nederlandse uitzendbureaus! Bij Olympia werken we vanuit gedeelde kernwaarden met als ideaal een samenleving waarin iedereen zich optimaal ontwikkelt door werk dat voldoening geeft. Onze ambitie is een high performance en een digital first organisatie te worden. We kunnen je hierdoor een inhoudelijk uitdagende rol bieden. Werken voor Olympia, dat betekent dit voor jou:




Voel je gewaardeerd in een omgeving waar iedereen welkom is
Maak, samen met ons, werk van je persoonlijke groei en ontwikkeling
Haal energie uit onze unieke ‘wij-maken-het-waar’ cultuur
Haal persoonlijke en maatschappelijke betekenis uit werk




En verder bieden we je uiteraard:




Een dienstverband van 36 of 40 uur per week. Jij bepaalt wat het beste bij je past.
Een passend salaris tussen € 3.350 en € 4.794, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
Bovengemiddeld veel vakantiedagen, 32,5 verlofdagen bij een 40-urige werkweek.
Onkostenvergoeding van €105,- netto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek.
Een mooie bonus aan het einde van het jaar.
Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een gunstige pensioenregeling en korting op verzekeringen.
Volledige reiskostenvergoeding op basis van al het openbaar vervoer of een kilometervergoeding vanaf 10 km (€ 23 ct.).
Een laptop en smartphone om je werk goed te kunnen uitvoeren.
8% vakantietoeslag.
Bij Olympia geven we onze collega’s de mogelijkheid om drie officiële feestdagen per jaar om te ruilen voor een andere culturele of religieuze dag die voor hen belangrijk is.
Het hybride werken met de juiste balans van werken op kantoor en vanuit huis.
Een inspirerende, moderne en bovenal duurzame werkplek. Wij zijn gevestigd in het Pharos-gebouw tegenover station Hoofddorp.
Opleidingsmogelijkheden die passen bij jouw ontwikkeldoelen.
Eens per jaar een “Dag van betekenis”. Een vrije dag die je volledig zelf invult om iets te doen wat veel voor je betekent.




Geïnteresseerd?

Wil je meer weten over Olympia? Of meer over de functie als Junior Data Scientist? Onze Recruitment Business Partner Merve Kaplan is bereikbaar op 06 51 05 70 91 of via m.kaplan@olympia.nl. Ken jij iemand anders waarvoor dit dé droombaan zou kunnen zijn? Stuur deze vacature dan vooral door en geef zo betekenis aan werk.

Title: AI/MLops Engineer
Description:
About Us:

At Lensor, we’re at the cutting edge of automotive AI, creating solutions that automate vehicle inspections. As a spin-off from PON, we blend the stability of an established company with the innovation and energy of a start-up. Our young, dynamic team is passionate about developing AI-driven products that make a tangible impact. With a culture that values creativity, diversity, and fun, we’re looking for talented individuals to join us in Amsterdam or remotely as we expand our operations.




Role Overview:

As an AI/ML Ops Engineer at Lensor, you’ll play a crucial role in deploying and managing AI/ML models, optimizing our infrastructure, and ensuring seamless integration across various platforms. This role offers a unique opportunity to work on innovative projects while growing your skills in a dynamic, supportive environment. You'll have the chance to shape the future of our product as we implement our solutions for customers.




What You’ll Do:

Model Deployment and Integration: Design, implement, and maintain scalable machine learning pipelines and deploy models to production with high availability.
Infrastructure and Automation: Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for ML model deployment and automate testing/validation workflows.
Data Preprocessing and Engineering: Work with large datasets to perform data cleaning, normalization, and transformation, and manage third-party data annotation processes.
Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor model performance, data drift, and implement robust logging and alerting systems.
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with AI Engineers and developers to streamline ML processes and communicate improvements.
Security and Compliance: Ensure all AI/ML operations comply with data privacy and security regulations.




Who You Are:

Python Proficient: Strong experience in Python and testing frameworks, with a solid foundation in software engineering.
AI/ML Enthusiast: Experience or strong interest in AI/ML technologies, with a desire to contribute to innovative projects.
Collaborative Team Player: You thrive in an international, dynamic environment and enjoy working closely with a diverse team.
Innovative Problem Solver: You’re creative, resourceful, and eager to tackle challenges in a fast-paced start-up.




What We Offer:

Innovation Days: Time to work on your own creative projects and initiatives.
Flexibility: A flexible, supportive work environment that values work-life balance.
Growth Opportunities: Endless opportunities to expand your skills and career in a growing start-up.
Strong Foundation: Stability from being part of PON, while enjoying the agility of a start-up.
Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, excellent pension scheme, and visa sponsorship, including 30% tax ruling support.
Tools & Equipment: MacBook, cell phone, and all necessary tools to excel in your role.
Generous Time Off: 20 vacation days plus an additional individual choice budget for extra leave.
Development Opportunities: Participate in summer and winter labs, training, and courses to enhance your skills.
Pon Fit Program: Access to fitness activities like bootcamps, running events, and more.
Health & Discounts: Collective health insurance discounts and staff discounts on Pon products.







Core Values at Lensor:

Pioneering Spirit: Passion for AI and technology, constantly pushing boundaries.
Customer Focus: Delivering solutions that solve real-world problems.
Innovation: Creativity and risk-taking are at the heart of what we do.
Community: Embracing diversity, fostering collaboration, and supporting each other’s growth.




How to Apply:

Are you as enthusiastic as we are about Lensor? Then we are looking forward to meeting you! Click on apply and upload your Motivation and CV!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you enjoy solving problems, looking at problems through a different lens, and working closely with customers to innovate new solutions to complex problems? Do you jump with excitement at the opportunity to identify trends and provide unique business solutions? Do you want to join a team where learning about a new technology or solution is part of our work every day?

The Industry Solutions Engineering (ISE) team is a global engineering organization that works directly with customers looking to leverage the latest technologies to address their toughest challenges. We work closely with our customers’ engineers to jointly develop code for cloud-based solutions that can accelerate their organization. We work in collaboration with Microsoft product teams, partners, and open-source communities to empower our customers to do more with the cloud. We pride ourselves in using, and making contributions to, open source and assisting our product teams to make our tools and platforms easier to use.

We develop solutions side-by-side with our customers through collaborative innovation to solve their challenges. This work involves the development of broadly applicable, high-impact solution patterns and open-source software assets that contribute to the Microsoft platform. In this role, you will be working with engineers from your team and our customers’ teams to apply your skills, perspectives, and creativity to grow as engineers and help solve our customers’ toughest challenges.

We are hiring a Data Scientist with deep expertise in machine learning and AI and experience in developing production quality solutions which deliver a huge business impact. The ideal candidate should also have deep industry experience in either Manufacturing, Energy, Mobility, Telecommunications sectors. As part of our team, you will be working side-by-side with high-impact engineers and strategic customers to solve complex problems. You will communicate trends and innovative solutions to stakeholders. You will work cross-functionally with several teams including engineering crews, product teams, and program management to deploy business solutions.

Our team prides itself on embracing a growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging everyone to share their unique viewpoints and be their authentic selves. Join us and help create life-changing innovations that impact billions around the world!

Responsibilities

Business Understanding and Impact 


Leads data-science projects or teams to align with business needs and deliver value. 
Brings new value to the business by leveraging your industry experience in terms of where resources and business needs should be allocated.
Leverages extensive experience to drive best practices for discovering, implementing, and maintaining transformative data-science solutions for customers.


Data Preparation and Understanding 


Leads data acquisition and understanding efforts for engineering projects using various tools and techniques. 


Modeling and Statistical Analysis 


Develops and applies ML frameworks and best practices for scalable and ethical solutions. 
Has deep mathematical understanding of statistics and machine learning
Incorporates best practices for ML modeling with consideration for artificial intelligence (AI) ethics.  


Evaluation 


Review, supports and provides best practices for data analysis and modeling techniques. 
Ensures selected modeling techniques are appropriate and align with desired project outcomes.
Decide on the next steps (e.g., deployment, further iterations, new projects). 


Industry and Research Knowledge/Opportunity Identification 


Serves as industry thought leader in data science in either of following fields: Manufacturing, Energy, Mobility, Telecommunications. 
Provides feedback, drives improvement, and shares knowledge as a data science and industry expert. 
Apply deep expertise to drive novel customer experiences, including early access engineering programs.  
Applies expertise to mitigate technical customer escalations.


Coding and Debugging 


Writes and debugs code for complex projects and leads solution development. 


Business Management 


Leads ML and data-science partnerships and IP improvement. 
Partners with diverse Microsoft teams to identify and explore opportunities for the novel application of machine learning (ML) and other data-science tools to above industry. 


Customer/Partner Orientation 


Provides customer-oriented insights and solutions by understanding the business, product, data, and customer perspective. 
Develops new techniques/methodologies for building solutions for a specific business need based on available data.  


Qualifications

Required Qualifications:


Doctorate in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
OR Master's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
OR Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND data science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
OR equivalent experience.
Customer-facing, project-delivery experience, professional services, and/or consulting experience.

Preferred Qualifications;


Experience working as part of geographically dispersed, diverse, and virtual teams.
Enjoy travel and are comfortable with travel up to 25%.
Demonstrated ability to work with customers and collaborate across company boundaries.


Our team prides itself on embracing a growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging everyone to share their unique viewpoints and be their authentic selves. Join us and help create life-changing innovations that impact billions around the world!

At Microsoft, we are seeking people who have a passion for the positive impact technology can have on communities and for making a difference in the world. Within ISE, you will find a wide range of backgrounds, perspectives, personal and cultural experiences which are vital to our success with our customers.  It’s an informal and flexible work environment and you’ll be welcome to work in the way that best enables you to get your job done.

We invest in your health, wellness, and financial future by offering a competitive package including a wide range of benefits built around your personal needs and those close to you.  

#ISEngineering

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

HTML:
Do you enjoy solving problems, looking at problems through a different lens, and working closely with customers to innovate new solutions to complex problems? Do you jump with excitement at the opportunity to identify trends and provide unique business solutions? Do you want to join a team where learning about a new technology or solution is part of our work every day?

The Industry Solutions Engineering (ISE) team is a global engineering organization that works directly with customers looking to leverage the latest technologies to address their toughest challenges. We work closely with our customers’ engineers to jointly develop code for cloud-based solutions that can accelerate their organization. We work in collaboration with Microsoft product teams, partners, and open-source communities to empower our customers to do more with the cloud. We pride ourselves in using, and making contributions to, open source and assisting our product teams to make our tools and platforms easier to use.

We develop solutions side-by-side with our customers through collaborative innovation to solve their challenges. This work involves the development of broadly applicable, high-impact solution patterns and open-source software assets that contribute to the Microsoft platform. In this role, you will be working with engineers from your team and our customers’ teams to apply your skills, perspectives, and creativity to grow as engineers and help solve our customers’ toughest challenges.

We are hiring a Data Scientist with deep expertise in machine learning and AI and experience in developing production quality solutions which deliver a huge business impact. The ideal candidate should also have deep industry experience in either Manufacturing, Energy, Mobility, Telecommunications sectors. As part of our team, you will be working side-by-side with high-impact engineers and strategic customers to solve complex problems. You will communicate trends and innovative solutions to stakeholders. You will work cross-functionally with several teams including engineering crews, product teams, and program management to deploy business solutions.

Our team prides itself on embracing a growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging everyone to share their unique viewpoints and be their authentic selves. Join us and help create life-changing innovations that impact billions around the world!

Responsibilities

Business Understanding and Impact 

  • Leads data-science projects or teams to align with business needs and deliver value. 
  • Brings new value to the business by leveraging your industry experience in terms of where resources and business needs should be allocated.
  • Leverages extensive experience to drive best practices for discovering, implementing, and maintaining transformative data-science solutions for customers.

Data Preparation and Understanding 

  • Leads data acquisition and understanding efforts for engineering projects using various tools and techniques. 

Modeling and Statistical Analysis 

  • Develops and applies ML frameworks and best practices for scalable and ethical solutions. 
  • Has deep mathematical understanding of statistics and machine learning
  • Incorporates best practices for ML modeling with consideration for artificial intelligence (AI) ethics.  

Evaluation 

  • Review, supports and provides best practices for data analysis and modeling techniques. 
  • Ensures selected modeling techniques are appropriate and align with desired project outcomes.
  • Decide on the next steps (e.g., deployment, further iterations, new projects). 

Industry and Research Knowledge/Opportunity Identification 

  • Serves as industry thought leader in data science in either of following fields: Manufacturing, Energy, Mobility, Telecommunications. 
  • Provides feedback, drives improvement, and shares knowledge as a data science and industry expert. 
  • Apply deep expertise to drive novel customer experiences, including early access engineering programs.  
  • Applies expertise to mitigate technical customer escalations.

Coding and Debugging 

  • Writes and debugs code for complex projects and leads solution development. 

Business Management 

  • Leads ML and data-science partnerships and IP improvement. 
  • Partners with diverse Microsoft teams to identify and explore opportunities for the novel application of machine learning (ML) and other data-science tools to above industry. 

Customer/Partner Orientation 

  • Provides customer-oriented insights and solutions by understanding the business, product, data, and customer perspective. 
  • Develops new techniques/methodologies for building solutions for a specific business need based on available data.  

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

  • Doctorate in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
    • OR Master's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
    • OR Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND data science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
    • OR equivalent experience.
  • Customer-facing, project-delivery experience, professional services, and/or consulting experience.
Preferred Qualifications;

  • Experience working as part of geographically dispersed, diverse, and virtual teams.
  • Enjoy travel and are comfortable with travel up to 25%.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with customers and collaborate across company boundaries.

Our team prides itself on embracing a growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging everyone to share their unique viewpoints and be their authentic selves. Join us and help create life-changing innovations that impact billions around the world!

At Microsoft, we are seeking people who have a passion for the positive impact technology can have on communities and for making a difference in the world. Within ISE, you will find a wide range of backgrounds, perspectives, personal and cultural experiences which are vital to our success with our customers.  It’s an informal and flexible work environment and you’ll be welcome to work in the way that best enables you to get your job done.

We invest in your health, wellness, and financial future by offering a competitive package including a wide range of benefits built around your personal needs and those close to you.  

#ISEngineering

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about both data science and (strategic) consulting? Do you like to create insights and turn them into action to create lasting impact? We are searching for an experienced Data Scientist for our Data & AI team to support our clients by combining business sense with data modelling. If this description fits your profile, we are looking for you!

The Data & AI team at IG&H is using the latest data and AI technology to help our clients innovate. To do so, our team of 25 data experts works closely together with our Technology and Sector teams. Through smart collaboration, we have delivered over 40 (Gen)AI projects in the last two years for our clients in Retail, Healthcare and Financial Services. As a Data Scientist, you will play a central role in truly understanding our client’s needs, translating this into value, creating solutions, developing Gen(AI) models and turning them into action. We believe it is key to have business sense as well as broad experience with data related topics (analytics, artificial intelligence, etc.) to create real business value. On top of that, you need to be able to communicate clearly and convincingly. Not only for effective project execution, but also to inspire (internal) stakeholders on the latest trends and developments in the field of Data and AI.

You will typically work in multidisciplinary project teams for one project at a time. Although being able to deliver work independently is appreciated, involvement of a project manager and technical experts ensures high-quality delivery and facilitates you to maintain a steep learning curve. We believe in diverse teams and diverse profiles in our Data & AI team. Some of our Data Scientists develop to be great consultants with technical knowledge and execution power, while others focus more on gaining deep technical expertise to deliver value from there. Working on a different range of projects in different sectors, you’ll be able to find your own sweet spot.

In addition, we believe that a caring and fun working environment will help you to dare to step out of your comfort zone and learn. We offer continuous learning through the IG&H Academy, in which you will get trainings to boost your data science, consulting and people skills. Also, you will be assigned a mentor, who will be there for you to provide you with guidance.

Above all, people are at the heart of what we do. This of course comes back in the work we deliver for our clients (why make a data product if the people who need to use it do not understand or want to use it?). At the same time, a fun working culture is key for who we are. With an inspiring office in Utrecht where we can connect, have abundant parties, team activities and sport events (both organized for the entire IG&H organization as well as specifically for the Data & Analytics team), IG&H is truly a Great Place To Work. And yes, we are certified!

Working for the Data & AI Team at IG&H Consulting is incredibly diverse, and fun at the same time. It’s been a great place to develop my technical know-how, management consulting skills and commercial effectivity. The team is young and ambitious, with a strong desire to solve complex puzzles, develop personally & professionally and do fun activities together. All in all, IG&H has been a great place to work for over 6 years already!

Lars van Kempen – Manager Data & AI

What you bring:

2+ years of relevant working experience at (among others) management consultancy firms, other professional services firms, and/or corporate data & AI teams
Python skills
Analytical, inventive and practical
A passion for Data & AI and the capability to translate business needs into impactful solutions
Drive to work in a fast-changing and high-demand, innovative environment
MSc degree, preferably in a technical field: e.g. Data Science, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Econometrics
You have excellent oral and written communication skills in Dutch and English

What we offer:

An opportunity to help clients to transform to become data-driven and make an impact through data & analytics
Working at a Great Place to Work with a pleasant atmosphere, enthusiastic colleagues who support you, where we put people first and encourage new initiatives
Working with exciting new (disruptive) technologies and international teams
Smart collaboration with talented consultants who will constructively challenge you
Company car / good mobility scheme
Permanent contract
The possibility to work parttime (32 hours), at least 4 days a week
25 holiday days with the possibility to take up five more
The possibility to take a sabbatical after 3 years of employment
IG&H facilitates a ‘"Health Human” program, where you get guidance with all adjustments in life after having a child
Generous bonus scheme
And more, which we would love to elaborate on

WHY IG&H?

IG&H is transforming leading companies across the Health, Retail and Finance sectors.

Together with our world-class technology partners, we help our clients move forward and stay relevant. With insightful advice, great design and unrivalled digital platforms. Our exceptional results come from successfully aligning people, business and technology.

With over 300 talented colleagues on board, people who genuinely embrace change and challenges, we’ve created a unique high-daring, high-caring culture. Attracting extraordinary people and inspiring them to push the boundaries for themselves and our clients.

If this vacancy is right for you, then this is a great place to work, with super happy employees and clients. We’re still just embarking on this exciting adventure. Why not be part of it?

We’re truly committed to diversifying our workforce and actively encourage women to apply for this role!

Moreover, we want our employees to reflect the diversity of society. We work together with a remarkable mix of talents, personalities and cultures. IG&H is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to national origin, race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, disability or age. We care about individuality, but most importantly, we share the pride of our collective achievements and a Great Place to Work.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About ITsPeople

ITsPeople is a leading management and consulting firm specializing in guiding organizations through complex digital transformations and enhancing their organizational agility. We empower our clients to navigate and overcome intricate business challenges by leveraging data-driven insights and managing large-scale transformation projects. Our mission is to help companies strengthen their market position by adopting advanced data analytics and AI, fostering a culture of agility, and driving sustained operational excellence.




Role Overview

As a Data Scientist at ITsPeople, you will be instrumental in transforming data into actionable insights that support our clients' strategic objectives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve complex problems, develop predictive models, and drive data-driven decision-making. This role is ideal for a highly analytical individual with a passion for uncovering patterns and insights from large datasets and communicating these findings effectively.




Key Responsibilities

Data Collection and Preparation: Gather, clean, and prepare large datasets from various sources for analysis, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Conduct exploratory analyses to discover trends, patterns, and anomalies in data, providing valuable insights to stakeholders.
Predictive and Diagnostic Modeling: Develop, implement, and evaluate machine learning models and algorithms to predict outcomes and diagnose issues.
Machine Learning and AI: Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to build models that address business challenges and optimize processes.
Data Visualization and Reporting: Create compelling visualizations and dashboards to communicate data insights and support decision-making processes.
Collaboration and Teamwork: Work closely with project teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and domain experts, to understand requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Continuous Learning and Improvement: Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data science and technology to continually improve methodologies and tools.




Required Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience: 0 to 3 years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related role. We welcome enthusiastic individuals looking to start or advance their career in data science.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools such as Jupyter Notebook, Tableau, or similar platforms. Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow) is a plus.
Soft Skills: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate effectively within teams.
Language skills: Fluency in Dutch and English is required.




Personal Attributes

Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Detail Oriented: Attention to detail in data analysis, modeling, and reporting, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables.
Proactive and Driven: Self-motivated and proactive in seeking out new challenges and opportunities to apply data science.
Team Player: Collaborative spirit with the ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams and contribute to a positive team dynamic.
Personal Leadership: Demonstrates initiative, responsibility, and the ability to lead and inspire others without formal authority.




Training and Development

At ITsPeople, we believe in the growth and development of our team members. We offer a robust training program designed to equip new and emerging professionals with the skills and knowledge needed to excel in their roles. Our comprehensive training covers the latest in data science techniques, tools, and industry best practices, providing you with the foundation to succeed and grow within our dynamic team.




Why Join ITsPeople?

Joining ITsPeople means being part of a vibrant and supportive team dedicated to driving transformative change for our clients through data-driven solutions. We value innovation, collaboration, and a customer-centric approach. As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects, engage with a diverse range of clients, and contribute significantly to their success.




We offer a stimulating work environment that promotes professional development and personal growth. You will have the autonomy to manage your projects, collaborate with senior consultants, and play a key role in our data-driven strategies.

Title: Data Scientist - Internship
HTML:
Create your own future

We are looking for an enthusiastic and compassionate intern to support the CMO Analytics team. You will directly get your hands dirty with data and programming. You will work among other highly motivated people who all aim to deliver business value by deploying data tools ready to be used.

That is what you will use your talents for as a Driving Data Analytics Intern at Van Lanschot Kempen. You will use your people & communication skills to inspire, convince and support digital and data adoption. During this internship you will work in a dynamic environment with various multidisciplinary DevOps teams and departments like the commercial colleagues of the Private Bank, Investment & Fiduciary Managers and Operations teams like Client Monitoring.

You also have the following tasks:

  • Work with a Product Owner and specialist to gather project requirements and implement a plan of action;
  • Work on data visualisation using preferably Power BI;
  • Develop or improve machine learning models;
  • Work with Azure DevOps and Azure Data Factory;
  • Create and maintain data engineering pipelines that fuel our ML models.

Your talents

Dynamic, outgoing and digital savvy. This is how we can best describe you in the position of Driving Data & Analytics Intern. Talents that you use to guide our customers in a constantly changing world every day. By thinking out of the box and asking questions. And all will be well if you also are analytical, result-oriented and have a hands-on mentality. In addition:

  • You are master's student in computer science, econometrics, statistics, data science or analytics with one or two courses in statistics, machine learning, data science or software development;
  • You have hands-on knowledge on backend programming, preferably python/SQL and front-end implementation in JavaScript/Node JS;
  • You have a good knowledge of PowerBI and Data Bricks;
  • You are available for at least 5 months for 32 to 40 hours a week;
  • You are passionate about new technology and tools and like to work with data;
  • Finance background and knowledge is a nice to have;
  • You have a good mastery of English, both oral and written.

Move ahead at Van Lanschot Kempen

Investing in a more future-oriented, sustainable, and data-driven way with various clients. Both nationally and internationally. With almost 300 years of experience, we make this ambition a reality at Van Lanschot Kempen. We do this with some 2,000 colleagues in various fields of expertise.

The Digital Innovation and Advanced Analytics department operates from the heart of Van Lanschot Kempen. It has four analytics teams that consist of highly skilled and motivated Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers & BI Dashboarding specialists. Enabling the entire Wealth Manager supercharging their decision-making by creating models, tools & dashboards for the commercial organisation, investment management and staff departments like Internal Control and Compliance. The teams work cloud native (Azure), with the latest techniques and languages. The department drives the organisation to work increasingly data-driven!

An organisation's degree of innovation and agility also depends on the diversity of its workforce. Our differences make us stronger together. We promote an inclusive work environment where all colleagues feel at home. With us, you can be yourself. And we are proud of that.

Curious about the stories of colleagues and how they experience working at Van Lanschot Kempen? Go to People & Projects and find out more!

Turning talent into value!

That’s what we do. The fact is, if you add value, you can obviously expect the same from us in return. In the Driving Data & Analytics Internship you will also be given:

  • Compensation of € 800,00 gross per month (based on 40h per week);
  • A company laptop and first access to the most innovative tools/products;
  • A creative and agile environment where you cooperate with ambitious teams;
  • A lot of responsibility and a large amount of autonomy;
  • A passionate internship supervisor who is a specialist in data science;
  • An environment to learn, make mistakes and develop yourself;
  • The opportunity to have an impact in one of the largest Wealth Managers in Benelux.

Working on tomorrow's capital

Just the vacancy you were looking for? Please submit your application.

Do you have any questions about the recruitment process? Please get in touch with Jessica Martins, Campus Recruiter, on +31 (0)6 57683187 or at j.martins@vanlanschotkempen.com

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Utrecht Omgeving - Retail - Fulltime




Breng dit data team naar een hoger niveau met je expertise in ML/AI! en jij een expert in het benutten van AI/ML en kun je Data Scientists helpen bij het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van productieklare modellen? Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het data analytics team voor een grote retailer in Nederland. Jij bent de specialist in MLOps en Cloud Computing, verantwoordelijk voor het productieklaar maken van AI/ML-oplossingen. Hiermee sla je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega's (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistiek, assortimentsoptimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.




Werkzaamheden:




Je werkt samen met het Data Science-team om sterke AI/ML-modellen te creëren, waarbij je zorgt voor grondige monitoring van de proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om fouten en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
Je biedt advies en oplossingen voor technische uitdagingen die zich tijdens het ontwikkelingsproces voordoen.
Als specialist in MLOps en CI/CD onderhoud en verbeter je continu de modellen.
Je fungeert als verbindingspersoon tussen Data Science en Global IT voor het gebruik van technologieën zoals Databricks en Azure, die door Global IT worden beheerd.
Je draagt actief bij aan de vooruitgang van technologie en tools door het ontwikkelen van utility packages en het verder ontwikkelen van MLOps-methodologie.
Je blijft op de hoogte van innovaties binnen MLOps en bepaalt hoe deze kunnen bijdragen aan de doelen.







Wat zit erin voor jou?




Een dynamische omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren en plezier hebt door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding
24 vakantiedagen en extra dagen op fulltime basis.
Mogelijkheid tot 19 extra vakantiedagen + mogelijkheid tot kopen of verkopen van vakantiedagen
Korting bij de retailer zelf
Leer- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met een interne academy.
2-3 dagen per week vanuit huis kunnen werken, flexibele uren
Kilometer vergoeding voor reis naar het kantoor.




Wie ben jij?

3+ jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of Data Scientist met affiniteit voor ML
Expertise in Python, PySpark en SQL
Ervaring met MLOps/ CI/CD cyclus en Git
Werken in scrumteams
Kennis van Databricks en Azure
Teamspirit en kunnen sparren met je collega's om zo mogelijke oplossingen voor te leggen.
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels




Ben jij de juiste fit? Neem nu contact op :)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Freeday, we aim to unlock human potential by leveraging disruptive technologies and building an AI-powered digital workforce that excels in repetitive tasks. By automating these tasks, we allow people to focus on more creative, rewarding work. We are a young, fast-growing IT company with a dynamic, no-nonsense culture. Located in the heart of Rotterdam, our team is driven by innovation, collaboration, and a passion for AI's potential to change the world.

Freeday is looking for a motivated Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-growing AI team. This is an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level by working on innovative machine-learning solutions that power our automated services. You will be involved in the development, deployment, and optimization of machine learning models, all within a supportive environment that encourages growth and learning.




As a Machine Learning Engineer at Freeday, you'll be surrounded by forward-thinking, innovative minds and cutting-edge AI technologies. Whether you’ve had 1 or 3 years of experience, we want someone who’s eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and contribute to the projects that will shape the future of automation.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to drive our automated services.
Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to define project objectives and align machine learning efforts with business goals.
Optimize machine learning algorithms for scalability and performance.
Contribute to the deployment of machine learning models in production environments using MLOps practices.
Continuously learn and adapt to new machine learning techniques and tools.
Take ownership of your projects while working in close collaboration with more senior team members for guidance and support.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary and pension plan.
Opportunities for professional development, including learning new machine learning techniques and tools.
A fun, inclusive, and collaborative team culture with regular social events, sports activities, and team-building opportunities.
The chance to work on impactful projects that automate workflows and unlock human potential.
A company laptop to support your work effectively.
Room for growth, initiative, and the chance to make a real difference within the team




Our Culture:




At Freeday, we’re not just about the work—we’re about you. We embrace a collaborative and innovative culture where ideas flow freely, and everyone is encouraged to take ownership. Whether you’re developing machine learning models or learning new skills, you’ll be part of a supportive environment where growth and personal development are key.




Requirements:

1-3 years of experience in machine learning or a related role, preferably in the tech sector.
Strong programming skills in Python and a good understanding of popular ML frameworks (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Basic familiarity with cloud technologies like AWS or Google Cloud.
Some experience or familiarity with MLOps tools like MLflow or Kubeflow is a plus.
You enjoy tackling challenges, are not afraid to take initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about automation, AI, and the potential of technology to solve real-world problems.
Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.




***

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About the job

MCA Engineering is a consulting company specializing in bringing technical know-how and ambitious organizations together, with offices in 9 countries. MCA Nederland is located in the city of Eindhoven, working with companies in the high tech, IT and automotive domains. MCA Nederland’s focus on internationality is what sets us apart, having consultants from more than 25 different nationalities working for our branch in Eindhoven. We are currently looking for a Data Scientist to work for one of our clients in Tilburg.




In this role, you will contribute to the development and optimization of cutting-edge electrolyzes, integral to the green energy transition. Electrolysis, a key process for hydrogen production, generates a multiphase flow of oxygen and hydrogen gas, which impacts water and temperature distribution within the electrolyze stack.




Responsibilities

Your objective will be to develop advanced computational models that describe and predict this complex behavior, driving efficiency and performance improvements.

• Contribute to cutting-edge projects in renewable energy, focusing on the development and optimization of electrolysers.

• Play a key role in advancing sustainable energy solutions to reduce carbon emissions and combat climate change.

• Develop advanced computational models for electrolysis, optimizing water and temperature distribution within the electrolyser stack.

• Collaborate with a dynamic scrum team of 8 skilled data professionals, including data engineers, analysts, and scientists.

• Bridge the gap between data engineering and data analysis teams to ensure seamless collaboration and data-driven decision-making.

• Utilize advanced data science tools and methodologies (machine learning, deep learning, GenAI) to tackle complex data challenges.

• Engage with stakeholders across various divisions, including Corporate Research and Digital




Requirements

• Proficiency in cloud platforms, preferably Azure, with familiarity in cloud infrastructure and services (e.g., Azure ML, Databricks).

• Strong experience in data science methodologies: model development, training, validation, and deployment, particularly in machine learning, AI, and GenAI.

• Expertise in data modelling, data cleaning, and feature engineering.

• Experience with data processing tools and ML platforms, such as Azure Machine Learning and Databricks (including ML suite).

• Strong understanding of data governance principles for compliant and organized data structures. • Proficiency in cloud programming languages (Python, SQL, JavaScript), and Python libraries such as TensorFlow, Pandas, PySpark, and Matplotlib.

• Experience in DevOps and MLOps environments, including automated model pipelines and CI/CD frameworks.

• Knowledge of version control tools such as Git and GitHub.

• Familiarity with testing strategies: unit, integration, acceptance, and functional testing.

• 3 to 5 years of experience in a data science role with demonstrated impact on production level projects.

• Affinity for mentoring and the ability to coach junior team members and provide technical guidance to the team




Your development perspectives

Our ambition is to make our teams diverse and sustainable! So, our primary objective is to make you successful so that you can access the various developments we offer. Eventually, you will be able to develop on multiple activity sectors, but also project yourself internally on Team Manager positions, for example. We can also offer you openings in our European subsidiaries if you are interested.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ready for a Challenge?

Then Just Eat Takeaway.com might be the place for you. We’re a leading global online food delivery platform, and our vision is to empower everyday convenience. Whether it’s a Friday-night feast, a post-gym poke bowl, or grabbing some groceries, our tech platform connects tens of millions of customers with hundreds of thousands of restaurant, grocery and convenience partners across the globe.

All About The Role

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our dynamic Sales Analytics team at Just Eat Takeaway.com. As part of our Functional Sales Analytics team, you will collaborate across multiple departments, acting as a center of excellence for machine learning best practices. In this role, you will focus on delivering new and enhancing existing machine learning applications that drive key sales operations, accelerating restaurant performance, improving sales forecasting, and enriching experiences for customers, restaurants, and drivers.

These are some of the key ingredients to the role:


Lead and deliver impactful data science projects from proof-of-concept to deployment, closely collaborating with stakeholders to ensure measurable business results.
Mentor and coach junior data scientists, helping them grow their skills and expertise.
Work closely with our Data ML engineering team to shape the development of our data warehouse and Machine Learning platform, streamlining advanced analytics across the company.
Provide technical guidance and consultation on data issues and solution feasibility to business stakeholders.
Collaborate with data scientists across the organization to establish best practices, standards, and foster a community of excellence.
Proactively identify opportunities for improvement across our data science landscape, ensuring critical issues are addressed swiftly.


What will you bring to the table?


Proven experience working in data science, particularly in applying machine learning and statistical methods to solve real-world problems in production environments.
Strong expertise in causal inference modelling, large language models (LLMs), and Sales-related machine learning projects such as customer lifetime value prediction, market segmentation, and Next-Best-Action.
Experience with cloud and big data technologies such as Google Vertex AI, Optimus, Airflow, and handling large-scale datasets in platforms like BigQuery.
Proficiency in Python, with the ability to read and write clean, efficient code beyond Jupyter notebooks, particularly in production-grade codebases.
Strong skills in SQL and NoSQL databases, working with tools such as Spark in cloud environments.
Experience working within agile teams, with a solid understanding of code reviews and source control best practices using GitHub.
Experience with Salesforce or any other CRM systems is a big plus.
Excellent communication skills, capable of delivering data-driven insights and collaborating effectively with diverse stakeholders.
Passion for coaching and mentoring, helping to elevate the skills of other data scientists.
The ability to consult with and provide technical direction to non-technical stakeholders.


At JET, This Is On The Menu

Our teams forge connections internally and work with some of the best-known brands on the planet, giving us truly international impact in a dynamic environment.

Fun, fast-paced and supportive, the JET culture is about movement, growth and about celebrating every aspect of our JETers. Thanks to them we stay one step ahead of the competition.

Inclusion, Diversity Belonging

No matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you are from, you can find your place at Just Eat Takeaway.com. We’re committed to creating an inclusive culture, encouraging diversity of people and thinking, in which all employees feel they truly belong and can bring their most colorful selves to work every day.

What else is cooking?

Want to know more about our JETers, culture or company? Have a look at our career site where you can find people's stories, blogs, podcasts and more JET morsels.

Are you ready to take your seat? Apply now!

Title: AI/ML Developer
Description:
AI solutions to enhance business experience

The Role

We are seeking a talented AI/ML Developer to join our innovative team. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in machine learning algorithms, data preprocessing, model development, fine-tuning large language models (LLMs), and working with big data. You will work on creating, deploying, and optimizing AI models to solve real-world problems and enhance our products.

Responsibilities


Design and develop machine learning models.
Preprocess and analyze large datasets.
Implement and optimize algorithms for performance and scalability.
Fine-tune large language models (LLMs) for specific applications.
Manage and analyze big data to derive insights and improve models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and ML technologies.


What We Offer


Competitive salary that reflects your skills, experience, and contributions to the company.
Flexible working hours and remote work options to support your personal and professional life.
Full reimbursement for business-related travel expenses for group meet-ups.
Individual benefits and bonuses.


Join us to work on cutting-edge AI projects and make a significant impact in a dynamic and collaborative environment!

Ideal Profile

Requirements


5+ years of experience in working with AI/LLMs.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
Experience with data preprocessing and feature engineering.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques.
Proven experience in fine-tuning large language models.
Experience with big data tools and technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Experience with RAG.


What's on Offer?


Work alongside & learn from best in class talent
Excellent career development opportunities
Leadership Role
Show more
HTML:
AI solutions to enhance business experience

The Role

We are seeking a talented AI/ML Developer to join our innovative team. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in machine learning algorithms, data preprocessing, model development, fine-tuning large language models (LLMs), and working with big data. You will work on creating, deploying, and optimizing AI models to solve real-world problems and enhance our products.

Responsibilities

  • Design and develop machine learning models.
  • Preprocess and analyze large datasets.
  • Implement and optimize algorithms for performance and scalability.
  • Fine-tune large language models (LLMs) for specific applications.
  • Manage and analyze big data to derive insights and improve models.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and ML technologies.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary that reflects your skills, experience, and contributions to the company.
  • Flexible working hours and remote work options to support your personal and professional life.
  • Full reimbursement for business-related travel expenses for group meet-ups.
  • Individual benefits and bonuses.

Join us to work on cutting-edge AI projects and make a significant impact in a dynamic and collaborative environment!

Ideal Profile

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in working with AI/LLMs.
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
  • Experience with data preprocessing and feature engineering.
  • Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques.
  • Proven experience in fine-tuning large language models.
  • Experience with big data tools and technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Experience with RAG.

What's on Offer?

  • Work alongside & learn from best in class talent
  • Excellent career development opportunities
  • Leadership Role

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Why Recharge.com

We are the leading one-stop-shop for branded payments, making online recharge possible for anyone, anywhere at any time — whether you or someone you love needs credit for calling, gaming, entertainment or money. This is your chance to join an ambitious scaleup in a state of rapid growth; we’ll push you to develop yourself and help you create a real impact in your role. Put simply: we could write history together.




We won’t bore you with a corporate spiel about how we might be taking on the world of branded payments (spoiler: we are). Instead, we’ll let the numbers speak for themselves: we bring consumers their favourite brands to their fingertips, with over 15,000 products available in every gift card category globally, $70 million in funding (and counting!), 20%+ growth in 2023. We also have a revenue target of €75 million in 2024, we're just getting started with 1.1 million app downloads in 2023, we are counting 5.0+ million active customers, a presence in 180 countries and 25 markets, a team of 150+ employees and 35+ nationalities, and 1 person missing — you.




We’re on the hunt for the hungriest and most passionate talent out there. If at any point your brain screams “I want in!” while you’re reading this, then consider this the sign you’ve been looking for: we want you too.




The role

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our Business Intelligence Team reporting to Nicolas Arrivé. You will work on improving our day to day business operations. You understand what kind of insights drive the right action. You have great analytical skills and are good at making people understand what needs to get done and why.




The BI team embeds actionable insights into the business teams, and drives commercial success (improving sales, margin and/or efficiency). Automation is also at the heart of our business practices when value can be extracted at scale.




What will I do?

As a Data Scientist you will play a vital part in defining our company strategy and execution across Payment flow, Paid Marketing, Customer base and product strategy.




You are part of the Business Intelligence team and you are the technical expert in modelling, testing and analytical techniques helping us analysing millions of consumer transactions.




You are modelling from scratch or improving existing statistical models aiming (among other things) at: predicting and explaining Churn, predicting and explaining next likely brand/transaction to happen, existing Marketing Mix Models, automating anomaly detection, existing Lifetime Value prediction model and many more core operational predictive processes. You can articulate the pros and cons of a given approach to numerous stakeholders.




You perform ad hoc advanced strategic analyses and turn these into KPIs that are relevant and easy to understand.

You are a de-facto code reviewer for the rest of the team for the code base you are the most proficient with.




You are improving the automation of some of our reporting tools (Tableau server and front end) for the most important views and KPIs the business relies on to make daily or weekly decisions & you are coaching and mentoring the rest of the team as you see fit on all things technical.




What you have:

3+ years experience in an analytics and/or data-science related field (preferably within the e-commerce industry)
3+ years experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets as well as data extraction tools such as Hive and/or SQL
Solid understanding of testing and modelling statistics (R2, p-value, t-test etc…)
3+ year experience with statistical software such as R, or coding language: Python
3+ years Experience with Data Visualisation tools (like Tableau and PowerBI ideally)
Hands-on experience with setting up test studies: A/B tests, Geo-experimentation and Lift studies




Nice to have:

Advanced knowledge of Customer, Marketing Analytics and modelling such as price elasticity test and formula, Marketing Mix Models, LifeTime Value calculations etc…
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Sociology or similar
Very advanced knowledge of Python or R




What we offer

30 days of holiday, a great pension scheme and one of the best relocation packages in Amsterdam
Flexible working hours and an office overlooking the Amstel
Macbook Pro or Windows Laptop
Budget for noise-canceling headphones, travel to and from the office, working-from-home and self-learning
Free healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks by our in-house chef
Free Dutch classes to help out with daily life in the Netherlands
Regular parties, celebrations and other events




The process

1. Apply: Want in? Let us know! Apply for a role and help us get to know your best self.

2. Phone interview: One of our recruiters will get in touch to help you both understand if Recharge is the right next move for you.

3. First interview: You’ll meet with your future line manager (either in person or online) to talk about you, our culture and whether you're a fit for the job.

4. Assignment & Second interview: Some roles involve a case study. Great! It’s your chance to shine and show us you have what it takes. You’ll present your case study to the Hiring Manager and someone from the team

5. Third Interview: You’ll meet with a key member of the management team

6. Offer: You did it! There are only a few tickets available, and this one has your name on it. Welcome to the team.

6. Offer: You did it! There are only a few tickets available, and this one has your name on it. Welcome to the team.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MLOps Engineer - Leading Investment Bank - The Hague - Hybrid remote - GenAI (RE-OPENED + URGENT ! ! !)




Together with the Director of Data Analytics of a leading Investment Bank in The Hague, I'm looking for an MLOps Engineer / Advanced Analytics Engineer.




This is a key position in a new small dedicated Advanced Analytics team, where you can take a pivotal role in pushing risk & ML Models into production:




Your responsibilities:

Automate, and maintain ML models using Databricks and AzureML
Collaborate with data scientists and business stakeholders to ensure ML & AI models are production-ready and meet performance standards - advise them with your MLOps knowledge!
Provide and implement innovative solutions to automate the production of AI and ML models for Predictive AI in the Risk Department
Work on GenAI and predictive modelling/AI




Teck Stack: Risk Models, Python, MLOps, AzureML, DataBricks, MATLAB, GUI, DevOps, Software Engineering, ETL, CICD, GenAI, PredictiveAI




Your profile:

The ideal candidate has 2/3 years experience within MLOps, preferably within Credit Risk, banking sector
Proficient in Python and designing, developing and maintaining ML models (Machine Learning models)
You've worked with Databricks, Python, AzureML, Azure Factory
Exposure to MATLAB




Environment: greenfield Data Analytics department & Centre of Expertise. They focus on implementing GenAI + Predictive AI. This department holds the largest budget of the whole bank; Innovation and Investment is at its core.




The bank offers great benefits:

32 (!!) holidays
Hyrid working from The Hague office
Best pension in the Netherlands (+30% of annual salary)
Excellent Learning & Development programs
NS Business card 1st Class




Are you a Medior - Senior Machine Learning or Data Science Engineer / Software Engineer or Data Engineer - with experience within MLOps?




Please apply!
