Title: Intern AI/ML Engineer
Description:
🚀 Now hiring for an AI/ML internship in the field of medtech & healthcare




⚡ About us

At Flowlined, we bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI technology and practical solutions. By collaborating with experts, we deliver AI that integrates seamlessly, is quick to implement, future-ready, and drives cost savings and efficiency. We're a dynamic bunch of AI-enthusiasts, passionate about solving real-world problems at a high pace.




🔍 What you’ll be doing:

Join an exciting internship where you'll work on a project in the healthcare sector with state-of-the-art AI/ML technologies such as computer vision and LLM's. You'll play a key role in improving patient condition diagnosis and treatment, by means of a multimodal approach. This project is in collaboration with instances in the field of medtech and healthcare, thereby providing real-world data and impactful results. You'll work in a multidisciplinary team, alongside AI/ML engineers, as well as subject matter experts to design and set up a complete data pipeline from acquisition to implementation.




🎯 Who we're looking for:

• Master's student with experience in AI/ML (computer vision skills are a plus)

• Currently studying Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, or a related discipline

• Enthusiastic about making a difference in a real-world use case

• Both Dutch and international students, based in the Netherlands

• Availability between 20-40 hours a week for the coming months with start date as soon as possible




💼 What we offer:

• Hands-on experience with the latest AI/ML technologies in healthcare

• Collaboration with an interdisciplinary team of medtech and healthcare experts

• A flexible, hybrid work environment (home and offices in Amsterdam/Eindhoven)

• An opportunity to impact real patient care through innovative medtech

• Internship allowance up to €1000 a month

• Dynamic team of techies who organize fun activities outside of work




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and be a part of transforming healthcare with AI/ML innovations!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
What is the role about?

Bitvavo is actively expanding our Data Science team within the Compliance, Legal and Risk departments. We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist with specific expertise in these areas to join our growing team. This crucial role reinforces Bitvavo's commitment to leveraging data across regulatory and risk frameworks, enhancing our data-driven approach.

As an integral part of the data team, you will play a vital role in shaping the future of cryptocurrency trading. Your responsibilities will include generating analytical insights, building models, developing data products, improving data quality and standards for informed decision-making, and providing stakeholders with the information they need to optimise their operations. A significant focus of your role will be on building models and data products that drive strategic business decisions and operational efficiencies.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

In your capacity as a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with Data Analysts, Analytics Engineers and Data Engineers to empower various business areas with data-driven insights. Your key responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:


Conducting comprehensive data analysis and building predictive models to tackle business challenges, uncover opportunities, and streamline processes in areas such as Risk, Fraud, Financial Crime, Compliance, and Operations
Establishing and nurturing partnerships with stakeholders to promote a culture of data-centric decision-making within Bitvavo
Leading the charge in data analytics and data science projects, from the planning stage through to execution, effectively turning insights into actionable strategies
Collaborating closely with the many product and engineering teams at Bitvavo to enhance data sets and pipelines in order to make Bitvavo more data-driven
Enabling the business by developing and deploying user-friendly self-service analytical tools, making them accessible to non-technical users and promoting widespread data utilization


How will you be successful?


At least 4 years of relevant experience in a Data Scientist/Quantitative Analyst role or similar, preferably with direct involvement in the CLR domain
Academic qualifications in STEM or related disciplines (Data Science, Computer Science or Econometrics)
Expertise in data analytics using scripting languages (SQL), BI tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI)
Solid command of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Tensorflow, Keras) for building predictive models and carrying out more sophisticated analyses
Enthusiasm for contributing to a fast-paced industry within a rapidly expanding company
Ability to simplify complex technical outcomes into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work across departments and with a wide range of stakeholders, bridging tech, product, and business needs to drive unified solutions


Bitvavo does not accept resumes from staffing, search, or recruitment firms without a signed agreement. If you send us a resume without such an agreement, we may contact the candidate directly without any obligation whatsoever and no fee of any kind will be paid should we hire the candidate.

Benefits

We care about our people. That's why we have a broad range of benefits to support them mentally, physically, and in their career growth. And an extra holiday for your birthday, just for fun.


Flexible well-being budget
Training and development budget
Competitive package
Hybrid working
Pension scheme
26 days holiday leave
Internet allowance
Mental health support platform
Show more

Title: R&D Data Scientist
Description:
About Flora Food Group

We offer consumers a compelling choice in four growing categories: butters and spreads, creams, liquids and cheeses. We hold leadership positions in many of the 100 countries we operate in, with iconic brands including Flora, Becel+ProActiv, Blue Band, Country Crock, I Can’t Believe It’s Not Butter, Rama, and Violife, together with our local brands and Professional business.

Global branded food champion Flora Food Group, offers the next generation of delicious, natural, nutritious food. Our products are more affordable and more sustainable than their dairy equivalents.

Location: Wageningen, Netherlands

Hybrid

About The Position

We're on the hunt for a dynamic and innovative Data Scientist to lead R&D projects. In this pivotal role, you'll leverage your analytical skills, data science skills and curiosity to unearth insights from complex data sets, driving the creation of next-generation plant-based products. With cutting-edge technology at your fingertips, you'll have the unique opportunity to shape the future of food!

As part of our Digital & AI R&D team, you'll be immersed in a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will collaborate with a team of passionate scientists, engineers, and culinary experts to develop predictive models and conduct experimental analysis that informs product development and optimization. Your expertise in data science will not only uncover new possibilities within our product range but also spearhead our efforts in sustainability and eco-friendly initiatives. This is your chance to be the future of food science, making significant contributions that go beyond the lab and into the lives of consumers worldwide. Join us in our mission to create delicious, plant-based products that are good for people and the planet.

You Will


Own the identification, development, testing, roll-out, and maintenance of R&D AI solutions.
Partner with subject-matter experts in relevant R&D teams, including understanding and implementing the specific business goals.
Collaborate with wider analytics and engineering teams to gather, manipulate and automate data pipelines used by models and the wider organisation.
Assist in the implementation of new data processes where relevant.
Become a subject-matter expert in R&D data and data processes.
Spearhead industry-first AI projects and stay ahead of advances in AI technology and techniques for use across the organization, including outside R&D


So, what does it take to be successful in this role?

You are a highly skilled data scientist with a degree in data science or a related technical or quantitative field, backed by over 3 years of professional experience, preferably within the FMCG industry with a focus on R&D as a MUST have. You possess expert-level proficiency in Python and are well-versed in PySpark, with substantial experience in utilizing machine learning and AI libraries. Your strong SQL skills enable you to efficiently extract and manipulate data from internal databases. Additionally, you have exposure to Power BI or Microsoft Fabric, or similar BI tools, which enhances your ability to present data-driven insights. A self-motivated problem solver, you are also a clear and effective communicator, capable of engaging with all levels of an organization, including C-suite executives. Your strong organizational skills, combined with a commitment to quality and integrity, allow you to thrive in fast-paced, entrepreneurial, and technical environments.

What’s next?

If this position sounds interesting, please hit the apply button now! If you have additional questions, you can send me, Elif Kocoglu, a WhatsApp message on +31615472665. The deadline to apply is the 25th of September.

We understand your resume might not be up to date and recommend that you apply with what you have or your LinkedIn Profile. Flora Food Group is dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workplace, we understand that you might not meet all the requirements stated in the description, but we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the right candidate for this role or other roles. 

Flora Food Group is an employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and equal opportunities for all. We recruit based only on values, qualifications, performance, skills, behaviours, experience, and knowledge. We ensure job advertisements are free from unintentional bias.

No personal characteristics should be a barrier to joining Flora Food Group. We prohibit discrimination and harassment based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or other personal characteristics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ben jij een ervaren Data Scientist die gedreven is om waardevolle inzichten te kunnen creëren uit complexe datasets? Wil je deel uitmaken van een professioneel team met getalenteerde en gepassioneerde experts, werken aan uitdagende projecten waarbij geavanceerde analysetechnieken worden toegepast om oplossingen te vinden voor complexe vraagstukken?

Dan zoeken wij jou:




Wat ga je doen:

Verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van grote en complexe datasets met behulp van geavanceerde statistische en machine learning technieken.
Identificeren van patronen, trends en relaties in de data om waardevolle inzichten en voorspellende modellen te ontwikkelen.
Werken aan uiteenlopende projecten, variërend van het optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen tot het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor het voorspellen van klantgedrag.
Vertalen van zakelijke vraagstukken naar data-analysevereisten en het leveren van innovatieve oplossingen.
Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams, waaronder data engineers, softwareontwikkelaars en business analisten, om data science-oplossingen te ontwikkelen en implementeren.
Communiceren van complexe analyseresultaten en technische concepten naar niet-technische stakeholders in een begrijpelijke en overtuigende manier.







Wat verwachten we:

Een afgeronde masteropleiding of PhD in een relevant vakgebied, zoals Data Science, Statistiek, Wiskunde of Computer Science.
Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren van data-analyseprojecten en het toepassen van statistische en machine learning technieken.
Uitgebreide kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python, R of SQL, en ervaring met Data Science-tools en -frameworks zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn of Azure stack.
Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe vraagstukken te doorgronden en innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen.
Ervaring met het werken met grote datasets en kennis van data cleaning, pre-processing en feature engineering.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk, om technische concepten en analyseresultaten duidelijk over te brengen aan verschillende stakeholders.
Teamgeest en het vermogen om effectief samen te werken in multidisciplinaire teams.
Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, in zowel woord als geschrift.
Ervaring binnen de gezondheidszorg is een pre!




Wat krijg je:

Uitdagende functie binnen een dynamisch en innovatief bedrijf.
Marktconform salaris en goede arbeidsvoorwaarden.
Goede pensioensregeling.
Uitdagende werkomgeving.
Professioneel en gezellig team (samenwerking, kennisdeling, team-uitjes).
Nieuw kantoor in Den Haag.
Werk hybride, thuis en op kantoor.
OV-vrij abonnement of lease auto.
Ruimte voor persoonlijke groei (opleidingsbudget en mogelijkheid om certificaten te behalen).
29 vakantiedagen.




Note: We ondersteunen geen Visa of Work Permit aanvragen

Show more

Title: Lead AI Engineer (Remote, Europe)
Description:
Nillion is humanity's first Blind Computer. It is powered by a decentralized network of nodes that enables "Blind Computation" through the coordination and orchestration of privacy enhancing technologies (PETs) such as multi-party computation (MPC) and homomorphic encryption (HE). Nillion believes Blind Computation will become the internet's base layer for all private data as PETs continue to mature. including the Founder of Indiegogo (Slava Rubin), Associate General Counsel of Coinbase (Lindsay Danas Cohen), Co-Founder of Hedera Hashgraph (Andrew Masanto) and several other high profile team members.

We're looking for a Lead AI Engineer with a strong background in generative AI models and an interest in Privacy Enhancing Technologies (PET). The ideal candidate will explore the intersection of generative AI and MPC, developing new techniques and methodologies that allow for secure, distributed AI computations. You will be working with the Nillion Product team and report to Nillion's AI Product Lead.

Requirements

Essential Requirements


Experience in a technical role which involved developing, fine-tuning and/or deploying AI systems at scale
Experience leading highly technical teams and/or projects (strong plus if AI-related)
In-depth understanding of recent transformer architectures / LLMs and their technical implementations
Familiarity with and/or experience using more traditional ML models such as BERT, CNNs, random forests, etc
Strong ability to think both technically about specific challenges, research questions, etc. and strategically about high-level direction, roadmap, etc
Ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to internal/external stakeholders with various backgrounds
Ability to effectively balance long-term research and short-term pragmatism
Proficiency in Python and related AI/ML frameworks & technologies (i.e., PyTorch, HuggingFace, Docker, etc.)
MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or a related field



Desirable Requirements


Previous experience at a high-growth startup
Previous deeptech experience
Strong entrepreneurial drive
Experience in or passion for cryptography, multi-party computation (MPC), confidential computing and/or other privacy-preserving technologies
Excitement about the concept of fully privacy-preserving AI
Contributions to open-source projects in the AI or privacy tech space



Responsibilities


You will design & execute a technical AI roadmap towards bridging the gap between AI and confidential computing, in close collaboration with our AI and cryptography team
You will work closely with our cryptography team, getting up to speed with the technical nuances & implementing AI models accordingly
You will adapt AI model architectures to work in a performant way under a confidential computing paradigm and technically implement these architectures in our AI toolkit
You will have regular touchpoints with AI developers on the Nillion network and integrate their feedback in our AI roadmap
You will work closely with our DevRel team and actively contribute to creating easy-to-use AI tools and suitable AI development workflows



Benefits

We offer the following perks as part of employment with Nillion:


Flexible working hours to accommodate lifestyles and a globally distributed team
Competitive compensation package
Make a big impact as a early contributor to an incredible founding team
Work on new problems in an incredible emerging and dynamic field
Learn from systems engineering, cryptography and product domain experts in a mentorship-oriented work culture
You don't need to be in an office or at a desk to have an impact anymore! We are fully remote, but value regular meet-ups


In summary, if you are interested in web3 infrastructure, innovation, new technology, and are interested in working with a high-caliber team, please apply. Nillion is committed to shaping a better world in all that they do. Their global team is built based on respect, inclusivity, diversity and excellence.

For more information on either the technology or company, there are several lectures at leading universities about the project such as Oxford University, Cambridge University, New York University, Columbia, and MIT. You can also visit Nillion's early website at www.nillion.com.
Show more
HTML:
Nillion is humanity's first Blind Computer. It is powered by a decentralized network of nodes that enables "Blind Computation" through the coordination and orchestration of privacy enhancing technologies (PETs) such as multi-party computation (MPC) and homomorphic encryption (HE). Nillion believes Blind Computation will become the internet's base layer for all private data as PETs continue to mature. including the Founder of Indiegogo (Slava Rubin), Associate General Counsel of Coinbase (Lindsay Danas Cohen), Co-Founder of Hedera Hashgraph (Andrew Masanto) and several other high profile team members.

We're looking for a Lead AI Engineer with a strong background in generative AI models and an interest in Privacy Enhancing Technologies (PET). The ideal candidate will explore the intersection of generative AI and MPC, developing new techniques and methodologies that allow for secure, distributed AI computations. You will be working with the Nillion Product team and report to Nillion's AI Product Lead.

Requirements

Essential Requirements

  • Experience in a technical role which involved developing, fine-tuning and/or deploying AI systems at scale
  • Experience leading highly technical teams and/or projects (strong plus if AI-related)
  • In-depth understanding of recent transformer architectures / LLMs and their technical implementations
  • Familiarity with and/or experience using more traditional ML models such as BERT, CNNs, random forests, etc
  • Strong ability to think both technically about specific challenges, research questions, etc. and strategically about high-level direction, roadmap, etc
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to internal/external stakeholders with various backgrounds
  • Ability to effectively balance long-term research and short-term pragmatism
  • Proficiency in Python and related AI/ML frameworks & technologies (i.e., PyTorch, HuggingFace, Docker, etc.)
  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or a related field


Desirable Requirements

  • Previous experience at a high-growth startup
  • Previous deeptech experience
  • Strong entrepreneurial drive
  • Experience in or passion for cryptography, multi-party computation (MPC), confidential computing and/or other privacy-preserving technologies
  • Excitement about the concept of fully privacy-preserving AI
  • Contributions to open-source projects in the AI or privacy tech space


Responsibilities

  • You will design & execute a technical AI roadmap towards bridging the gap between AI and confidential computing, in close collaboration with our AI and cryptography team
  • You will work closely with our cryptography team, getting up to speed with the technical nuances & implementing AI models accordingly
  • You will adapt AI model architectures to work in a performant way under a confidential computing paradigm and technically implement these architectures in our AI toolkit
  • You will have regular touchpoints with AI developers on the Nillion network and integrate their feedback in our AI roadmap
  • You will work closely with our DevRel team and actively contribute to creating easy-to-use AI tools and suitable AI development workflows


Benefits

We offer the following perks as part of employment with Nillion:

  • Flexible working hours to accommodate lifestyles and a globally distributed team
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Make a big impact as a early contributor to an incredible founding team
  • Work on new problems in an incredible emerging and dynamic field
  • Learn from systems engineering, cryptography and product domain experts in a mentorship-oriented work culture
  • You don't need to be in an office or at a desk to have an impact anymore! We are fully remote, but value regular meet-ups

In summary, if you are interested in web3 infrastructure, innovation, new technology, and are interested in working with a high-caliber team, please apply. Nillion is committed to shaping a better world in all that they do. Their global team is built based on respect, inclusivity, diversity and excellence.

For more information on either the technology or company, there are several lectures at leading universities about the project such as Oxford University, Cambridge University, New York University, Columbia, and MIT. You can also visit Nillion's early website at www.nillion.com.

Title: AI Researcher (LLM) - (100% remote)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Show more

  • Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
  • Excellent programming skills in Python.

Title: Data Scientist International Investments
Description:
Als Data Scientist binnen het International Investments team verbeter jij de kwaliteit van het investeringsproces. Samen met collega's beleg je namens pensioenfondsen wereldwijd in vastgoed. Jij werkt op het spannende snijvlak van vermogensbeheer en data science. Met behulp van de laatste data science technieken zorg jij ervoor dat investeringsbeslissingen sneller, efficiënter en stevig onderbouwd worden genomen. Je bouwt mee aan een gestandaardiseerd, datagedreven beleggingsproces. Ook bedenk je en werk je mee aan de ontwikkeling van nieuwe beleggingstools. Daarnaast optimaliseer en automatiseer je bestaande beleggings- en besluitvormingsprocessen en lever je gedetailleerde inzichten via dashboards en rapportages aan zowel het team als aan de investeerders.




Je komt te werken op de afdeling International Investments. Dit team bestaat uit drieëntwintig professionals verspreid over kantoren in Amsterdam, New York en Sydney. Binnen de afdeling International Investments ben je onderdeel van het Quantitative Portfolio Management (QPM) team. Binnen het team ben jij de specialist op het gebied van data analytics en Python, de programmeertaal die binnen Bouwinvest leidend is.




Meer weten over deze vacature met bijbehorende voorwaarden?

Klik dan op de solliciteer-button om de volledige vacature te zien op onze werken-bij pagina en laat daar jouw gegevens achter bij interesse!

Title: Data Engineer AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Engineer AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Engineer AI ben je mede-verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling van data-gedreven AI-producten. Om dit te doen pas je jouw expertise toe van (cloud-gebaseerde) data-infrastructuur om data te koppelen, organiseren en te ontsluiten t.b.v. de AI-modellen. Je zorgt hierbij voor een slim ontwerp, ontwikkeling en integratie van datasystemen om zo het data ecosysteem te optimaliseren en waarde te creëren met data.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare data verwerkings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia en andere data-analyse georiënteerde programmeertalen;
  • Kennis van of ervaring met het bouwen van datapipelines is een pré;
  • Ervaring met data-clouds, data-lakes en/of data-warehouses;
  • Bekend met de AI en Data Science frameworks, libraries en tools;
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI-team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI;
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Engineer AI kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Senior Data Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Dit ga je doen

Weet jij hoe je een AI/ML-model efficiënt en snel kan draaien met miljoenen regels data en kan jij de API-snelheid verhogen zodat de eindgebruiker snel resultaten ontvangt? Weet jij pyspark/python en SQL optimaal te gebruiken en hoe je een script onderhoudsvriendelijk en productiewaardig maken? Dan zoek we jou om ons datateam te versterken! Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het Data Analytics-team voor Kruidvat (Nederland en België) en Trekpleister. Jij bent de expert op het gebied van MLOps en werkt met talen als pyspark, SQL en natuurlijk python. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het productiewaardig maken van de AI/ML-oplossingen. Daarmee vorm je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega’s uit het team (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistieke planning, assortiment optimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.

Als grootste Health & Beauty retailer in de Benelux hebben we een schat aan data die we kunnen gebruiken. Elke week worden we bezocht door meer dan vier miljoen klanten in onze ruim 1500 winkels en webshops. Ruim de helft van onze klanten is lid van de Kruidvat Club waardoor we onze klant steeds beter leren kennen.

Wat doe je zoal als ML Engineer in de dagelijkse praktijk?


Je ontwikkelt samen met Data Science robuuste AI/ML-modellen met goede monitoring op proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om bugs en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
Je adviseert en komt met oplossing voor technische uitdagingen waar je tijdens het ontwikkelproces tegenaan loopt. Denk hierbij aan het verbeteren van de API snelheid of andere trage processtappen in de modelflow.
Je bent een expert in MLOps en CI/CD, onderhoudt de (ML-)modellen en neem initiatief om deze continu te blijven verbeteren.
Je vormt de brug tussen Data Science en Global IT als het gaat om het gebruik van de technologieën (Databricks/Azure), die worden beheerd door Global IT.
Je denkt mee en draagt actief bij aan de ontwikkeling van onze technologie en tooling d.m.v. het ontwikkelen van bijvoorbeeld utility packages of het verder ontwikkelen van onze MLOps-methodiek.
Je blijft mee-ontwikkelen op de innovaties binnen het vakgebied en stelt vast hoe we hiermee invulling kunnen geven aan onze ambities.


Als organisatie investeren we fors in het neerzetten van een state-of-the-art analytics landschap. Als ML Engineer word jij binnen AS Watson Benelux (o.a. Kruidvat, Trekpleister) gezien als expert en dé aangewezen persoon om naar toe te gaan met vragen over Machine Learning (MLops) en andere Cloud-oplossingen. 

Dit krijg je ervoor terug

Een snelle omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren. En werkplezier door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en de ruimte om jezelf te ontplooien. Maar er is meer...  


Best belangrijk: een goed salaris! Afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding start je tussen de € 4.300,- en € 6.500,- bruto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek. Plus personeelskorting bij Kruidvat, Trekpleister en ICI PARIS XL! 
24 vakantiedagen en een aantrekkelijke ATV-regeling met 19,5 dagen op fulltime basis. Liever meer vrije tijd of extra geld? Koop of verkoop vakantiedagen of laat je ATV (deels) uitbetalen. 
Volop ontwikkelings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met onze eigen AS Watson Academy. Bij AS Watson sta je nooit stil.
Goede thuiswerkmogelijkheden. Hybride werken is bij ons heel gewoon en gaat altijd in goed overleg.


Dit ben jij


Je hebt een afgeronde opleiding op WO-niveau. Je hebt een MSc in bijvoorbeeld Computer Science, AI, Data Science.
Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of als Data Scientist. Je hebt expertise (must) in de programmeertalen Python, PySpark en SQL.
Je hebt kennis van Cloud-oplossingen, bij voorkeur Databricks en Azure.
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met het in productie zetten, onderhouden en monitoren van AI/ML-oplossingen en de MLOps en CI/CD cyclus. Werken met Git is business as usual. Werken met Scrum en Jira is je bekend.
Je bent in staat om met overtuiging je (technische) werk en de uitkomsten helder uit te leggen aan je collega’s. Verder vind je het leuk om met je collega’s te sparren over mogelijke oplossingen en mee te helpen aan de verdere professionalisering van onze afdeling.
Je vindt het leuk om te schakelen tussen business oplossingen met de datacollega’s en de technologie met de IT-collega’s.
Omdat je internationale contacten hebt, beheers je naast het Nederlands ook het Engels goed in woord en geschrift.


Bureaus: leg de telefoon maar weer neer, we doen het zelf.

Title: Data Scientist - Modelbouwer
Description:
Voor ons Data Science Pricing team zoeken we een getalenteerde en veelzijdige Modelbouwer/Data Scientist.




Heb jij een passie voor het bouwen van geavanceerde prijsmodellen in actuariële context en beschik je over uitstekende wiskundige kennis? Heb je ervaring met optimalisatietechnieken? Én kun je deze wiskundige problemen omzetten in hoogstaande Python code? Dan is deze rol perfect voor jou!




In het Data Science Pricing team speel jij een sleutelrol in het ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van onze prijsmodellen. Samen met pricing analisten vertaal je complexe pricing problemen naar wiskundige modellen, zoals optimalisatie- en regressiemodellen. Vervolgens werk je met Python developers en data engineers om deze modellen te implementeren in hoogwaardige Python software om onze prijsstrategieën te verbeteren en te vernieuwen.




De afdeling

Je komt te werken bij de divisie Centraal Beheer, waar innovatie, digitalisering én data centraal staan. In 2023 zijn we uitgeroepen tot Data & Insights Company of the Year. Onze afdeling Data & Analytics (D&A) telt ruim 100 collega’s en is opgesplitst in de teams Data Consulting, Data Science, Omnichannel Personalisatie, Reporting en Data Engineering. Je bent onderdeel van het Data Science team (11 collega’s). Het team werkt volledig hybride. Dat wil zeggen dat zij op maandag op kantoor zijn om de verbinding met elkaar te houden. De andere dagen kan je werken waar je wil, thuis of op een Achmea locatie. Jouw collega's komen ook uit het hele land en maken graag gebruik van het hybride model.




Jouw achtergrond

Je bent wo afgestudeerd, bijvoorbeeld in de richting van wiskunde, natuurkunde of econometrie.
Je hebt jouw uitstekende wiskundige kennis ingezet om complexe problemen op te lossen, aantoonbare ervaring met optimalisatietechnieken
Je beschikt over minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring. Daarin ben je verantwoordelijk geweest voor de ontwikkeling of optimalisatie van modellen
Je bent bekend met de context van pricing of actuariaat
Jij beheerst Python als geen ander
Je werkt graag samen met andere vakgenoten, en vakgenoten werken nog liever samen met jou




Wat krijg je van ons

Als medewerker bij Achmea zet jij je elke dag in voor een gezonde, veilige én duurzame toekomst. En daar belonen we je graag voor! Natuurlijk krijg je bij ons een goed salaris van €€4.333 - €5.950 (exclusief PKB) op basis van 34 uur per week, een mooie pensioenregeling mét lage eigen bijdrage (3,25%), 136 verlofuren (op basis van 34 uur per week) én korting op onze verzekeringen.




Maar er is meer!

34-urige werkweek: Een 34-urige werkweek is bij Achmea de standaard! Je werkt dan bijvoorbeeld 4 dagen van 8,5 uur. Zo heb je nóg meer tijd voor vrijwilligerswerk, een goed boek, mantelzorg óf jouw favoriete sport!
All You Can Learn: Onder de noemer All You Can Learn volg je opleidingen, cursussen en trainingen. De wereld van leren en ontwikkelen ligt bij ons aan je voeten!
Klimaatbudget: Ben je langer dan 12 maanden in dienst? Dan krijg je €2.500 netto klimaatbudget (bij fulltime dienstverband) om je huis te verduurzamen, duurzaam witgoed te kopen óf bijvoorbeeld een elektrische fiets aan te schaffen. Dit bedrag is bedoeld voor producten en diensten die een bijdrage leveren aan verduurzaming en verbetering van het milieu.
Healthy initiatieven: Gezond werken vinden we belangrijk, dus zorgen we ook dat dit kan met een berg healthy initiatieven!
Persoonlijk keuzebudget: Je ontvangt maandelijks een persoonlijk keuzebudget, opgebouwd uit 8% vakantietoeslag, 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering en 3,85% bovenwettelijk verlof. Je kiest zelf op welk moment je dit budget laat uitbetalen, je het gebruikt voor verlofsparen of dat je er vakantie-uren van koopt.
Show more
HTML:
Voor ons Data Science Pricing team zoeken we een getalenteerde en veelzijdige Modelbouwer/Data Scientist.


Heb jij een passie voor het bouwen van geavanceerde prijsmodellen in actuariële context en beschik je over uitstekende wiskundige kennis? Heb je ervaring met optimalisatietechnieken? Én kun je deze wiskundige problemen omzetten in hoogstaande Python code? Dan is deze rol perfect voor jou!


In het Data Science Pricing team speel jij een sleutelrol in het ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van onze prijsmodellen. Samen met pricing analisten vertaal je complexe pricing problemen naar wiskundige modellen, zoals optimalisatie- en regressiemodellen. Vervolgens werk je met Python developers en data engineers om deze modellen te implementeren in hoogwaardige Python software om onze prijsstrategieën te verbeteren en te vernieuwen.


De afdeling

Je komt te werken bij de divisie Centraal Beheer, waar innovatie, digitalisering én data centraal staan. In 2023 zijn we uitgeroepen tot Data & Insights Company of the Year. Onze afdeling Data & Analytics (D&A) telt ruim 100 collega’s en is opgesplitst in de teams Data Consulting, Data Science, Omnichannel Personalisatie, Reporting en Data Engineering. Je bent onderdeel van het Data Science team (11 collega’s). Het team werkt volledig hybride. Dat wil zeggen dat zij op maandag op kantoor zijn om de verbinding met elkaar te houden. De andere dagen kan je werken waar je wil, thuis of op een Achmea locatie. Jouw collega's komen ook uit het hele land en maken graag gebruik van het hybride model.


Jouw achtergrond

  • Je bent wo afgestudeerd, bijvoorbeeld in de richting van wiskunde, natuurkunde of econometrie.
  • Je hebt jouw uitstekende wiskundige kennis ingezet om complexe problemen op te lossen, aantoonbare ervaring met optimalisatietechnieken
  • Je beschikt over minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring. Daarin ben je verantwoordelijk geweest voor de ontwikkeling of optimalisatie van modellen
  • Je bent bekend met de context van pricing of actuariaat
  • Jij beheerst Python als geen ander
  • Je werkt graag samen met andere vakgenoten, en vakgenoten werken nog liever samen met jou


Wat krijg je van ons

Als medewerker bij Achmea zet jij je elke dag in voor een gezonde, veilige én duurzame toekomst. En daar belonen we je graag voor! Natuurlijk krijg je bij ons een goed salaris van €€4.333 - €5.950 (exclusief PKB) op basis van 34 uur per week, een mooie pensioenregeling mét lage eigen bijdrage (3,25%), 136 verlofuren (op basis van 34 uur per week) én korting op onze verzekeringen.


Maar er is meer!

  • 34-urige werkweek: Een 34-urige werkweek is bij Achmea de standaard! Je werkt dan bijvoorbeeld 4 dagen van 8,5 uur. Zo heb je nóg meer tijd voor vrijwilligerswerk, een goed boek, mantelzorg óf jouw favoriete sport!
  • All You Can Learn: Onder de noemer All You Can Learn volg je opleidingen, cursussen en trainingen. De wereld van leren en ontwikkelen ligt bij ons aan je voeten!
  • Klimaatbudget: Ben je langer dan 12 maanden in dienst? Dan krijg je €2.500 netto klimaatbudget (bij fulltime dienstverband) om je huis te verduurzamen, duurzaam witgoed te kopen óf bijvoorbeeld een elektrische fiets aan te schaffen. Dit bedrag is bedoeld voor producten en diensten die een bijdrage leveren aan verduurzaming en verbetering van het milieu.
  • Healthy initiatieven: Gezond werken vinden we belangrijk, dus zorgen we ook dat dit kan met een berg healthy initiatieven!
  • Persoonlijk keuzebudget: Je ontvangt maandelijks een persoonlijk keuzebudget, opgebouwd uit 8% vakantietoeslag, 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering en 3,85% bovenwettelijk verlof. Je kiest zelf op welk moment je dit budget laat uitbetalen, je het gebruikt voor verlofsparen of dat je er vakantie-uren van koopt.

Title: Lift Engineer
Description:
Liftmonteur – De Held die Mensen in Beweging Brengt!

Heb jij een passie voor sleutelen en wil je dagelijks bijdragen aan het verbeteren van iemands mobiliteit? Dan hebben wij de perfecte baan voor jou! Wij zijn op zoek naar gemotiveerde liftmonteurs die met hun handen én hun hart willen werken.




Wat ga je doen als Liftmonteur?

Je zorgt ervoor dat onze trapliften soepel en veilig werken, zodat mensen die minder mobiel zijn weer vrij kunnen bewegen in hun eigen huis. Van installatie tot onderhoud, jij bent de technische held die dit mogelijk maakt. En ja, dat doe je met een glimlach!

Wie ben jij?

- Je hebt sleutelervaring (denk aan auto's, motoren, of gewoon klussen in huis).

- Minimaal een niveau 2 diploma, maar we geven de voorkeur aan niveau 3 of 4.

- Representatief: jij bent iemand die je zonder zorgen bij je ouders of grootouders langsstuurt.

Wat krijg je van ons?

- Dankbaar werk: je maakt echt verschil voor mensen met een mobiliteitsbeperking.

- Korte lijnen en een gezellige familiecultuur.

- Je eigen bus (ook privé te gebruiken bij vast dienstverband) + gereedschap en je mag zelfs je eigen werkschoenen kiezen.

- Nachtwerk? Geen zorgen, je krijgt daarna recht op 8 uur slaap voor je weer aan de slag hoeft.

- Salaris bij start tussen de €3.000 en €3.500 per 4 weken, met een extra maand uitbetaling per jaar.

- 26 vakantiedagen en 13 ATV-dagen. Over? Je kunt ze verkopen voor een fiets, laptop, sportabonnement of telefoon!

- Doorgroeimogelijkheden naar Teamleider.




Waar zoeken we monteurs?

- Amsterdam

- Eindhoven

- Den Haag

- Midden Nederland (Utrecht, Amersfoort, Hilversum en omstreken)




Waarom bij ons?

Omdat je met ons werk écht een verschil maakt. We houden van korte lijnen, een open cultuur, en we zorgen goed voor onze mensen. Klinkt dit als jouw nieuwe baan? Solliciteer nu en word onze nieuwe liftmonteurheld!




Sta jij klaar om te sleutelen aan de toekomst van onze klanten? Wij horen graag van je!

Show more

Title: Machine Vision Engineer
HTML:
Highlights

– Salaris tot €5.200,- bruto per maand;

– Werken met de nieuwste AI-aangedreven technologieën;

– Groeien binnen een innovatief en internationaal georiënteerd bedrijf.


Wat ga jij doen

Wil jij werken aan de nieuwste technologie binnen de vision en AI? Als Vision Engineer ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling van software-algoritmes en optische set-ups voor nieuwe machines. Je werkt met de nieuwste AI-aangedreven technologieën en vision software, waardoor wij altijd een stap voor zijn op de concurrentie. Je komt te werken binnen de innovatieve R&D-afdeling, bestaande uit 26 specialisten op het gebied van werktuigbouwkunde, robotica, software en vision. Samen met jouw team ontwikkel je machines die nog niet bestaan, met toepassingen in diverse sectoren. Je rapporteert aan de Teamlead en werkt nauw samen met andere softwareprogrammeurs en engineers.


Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

– Ontwerpen van vision systemen samen met Vision System Engineers en R&D;

– Testopstellingen bedenken, inrichten en uitvoeren met het R&D-team;

– Programmeren van vision-algoritmes;

– Analyseren, kalibreren en testen van de nieuwste softwaresystemen;

– Selecteren van hardware zoals camera’s, belichting en software;

– Ondersteunen bij de eerste uitrol van nieuwe systemen, intern en op locatie bij klanten;

– Deelname aan werkoverleggen en toolbox meetings;


Wat wij bieden

– Salaris van €3.500 tot €5.200,- bruto per maand afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring;

– 25 vakantiedagen en 13 ADV-dagen;

– Reiskosten vergoeding van €0.23 en een goede pensioenregeling

– Opleidingsbudget van €1.200,- en aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling

– Innovatieve en groeiende werkomgeving;

– Hecht en collegiaal team van gespecialiseerde engineers;

– Werken bij een toonaangevend en internationaal bedrijf.


Wat wij zoeken

– Afgeronde WO-opleiding in een technische richting;

– Ervaring met camera hardware, lenzen, multi-camerakalibratie, en verlichting;

– Kennis van Python en computer vision libraries zoals OpenCV, Halcon;

– Ervaring met machine learning frameworks zoals TensorFlow, Keras en PyTorch;

– Kennis van Linux, Bash, C++ en Docker is een Pré;

– Affiniteit met robotica en AI/Deep learning.


Organisatie

Onze partner organisatie is een snelgroeiend innovatief bedrijf dat wereldwijd automatiseringsoplossingen levert. Hun expertise ligt in machine vision, robotica en fijnmechanica. Zij ontwikkelen geavanceerde machines voor onder andere de tuinbouw, met oplossingen die minder ruimte innemen, schaalbaar zijn en lagere onderhoudskosten hebben. De organisatie bestaat uit 120 medewerkers verspreid over vestigingen in Nederland en de VS, en richt zich op sectoren als R&D, engineering en service. Elk jaar worden naast de standaard lijn nieuwe machines ontworpen en op de markt gebracht.


Heb ik jou weten te enthousiasmeren?

Voor meer informatie kan je contact opnemen met Maikel Henckens op telefoonnummer: 06 11 85 61 20 of via e-mail: maikel.henckens@comaen.nl Whatsappen voor meer informatie? Stuur mij geheel vrijblijvend een bericht op het bovenstaande nummer.


Waarom anderen jou voorgingen in het werken via Comaen

Bekijk dan hier ons YouTube-kanaal of lees de beoordelingen van andere engineers op comaen.nl/reviews.

Title: Data Scientist II
Description:
Do you enjoy working with innovative research

technology?

Would you like to be part of a team that creates

solutions for our customers?

About Our Team

LexisNexis Legal & Professional, which serves customers in more than 150 countries with 11,800 employees worldwide, is part of RELX, a global provider of information-based analytics and decision tools for professional and business customers. Our company has been a long-time leader in deploying AI and advanced technologies to the legal market to improve productivity and transform the overall business and practice of law, deploying ethical and powerful generative AI solutions with a flexible, multi-model approach that prioritizes using the best model from today’s top model creators for each individual legal use case.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist, you will extract insights from large, complex datasets using diverse analysis techniques. You'll use data preparation, modeling, and visualization to solve intricate business problems.

Extracts knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data in order to investigate complex business problems through a range of data preparation, modeling, analysis and/or visualization techniques, which may include statistical analysis, predictive modeling and pattern recognition | Typically uses existing data platforms and tools (ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases, data analysis and visualization software) but may also use object-oriented programming to develop own scripts and visualizations.

A Data Scientist II should have a basic understanding of best-practice and can execute the methods for projects with supervision. Individuals in this role will continue to provide support to the Data Scientist team members and also begin to lead some analytic efforts.

Responsibilities


Extracting knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data
Investigating complex business problems through data preparation, modeling, and analysis
Utilizing statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and pattern recognition techniques
Using existing data platforms and tools for data analysis and visualization
Developing own scripts and visualizations using object-oriented programming
Providing support to senior Data Scientists and leading some analytic efforts
Pulling data, cleaning data, and maintaining datasets and models
Participating in result presentation to internal stakeholders


Requirements


Hold at least a bachelor's degree in a relevant field
Have a solid background of relevant work experience or a master's degree in a related field.
Be experienced in NLP and classic machine learning frameworks (pandas, scikit, etc)
Possess good SQL skills and practical knowledge of XML
Demonstrate a basic understanding of best practices in data science
Be able to execute methods for projects with supervision
Have practical experience with ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases
Be capable of utilizing data analysis and visualization software


Work in a way that works for you

We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.


Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive


Working for you

Benefits

We know that your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:


Dutch Share Purchase Plan
Annual Profit Share Bonus
Comprehensive Pension Plan
Home, office or commuting allowance
Generous vacation entitlement and option for sabbatical leave
Maternity, Paternity, Adoption and Family Care leave
Flexible working hours
Personal Choice budget
Variety of online training courses and career roadshows
Wellbeing programs and gym facility in the office
Internal communities and networks
Various employee discounts
Recruitment introduction reward
Work from anywhere
Employee Assistance Program (global)
Annual Event


About The Business

LexisNexis Legal & Professional® provides legal, regulatory, and business information and analytics that help customers increase their productivity, improve decision-making, achieve better outcomes, and advance the rule of law around the world. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its Lexis® and Nexis® services.

Title: AI Research Scientist (all genders)
Description:
Join Our Team at Seedbox: Innovating for a Better Tomorrow

Are you ready to be part of a visionary team that's redefining the landscape of AI-driven innovation? At Seedbox, we are more than just a company; we are a dynamic force of change-makers, driven by the shared vision of our founders. Our journey began with a bold idea – to harness the untapped potential of Artificial Intelligence in transforming the German "Mittelstand," the backbone of our economy. Today, we stand as a beacon of transformation, seamlessly blending the rich heritage of corporate innovation with cutting-edge AI expertise.

Our focus is on creating AI solutions that are intuitive and seamlessly integrate with our client's business processes. Thus, our approach is deeply collaborative, from ideation to development, believing that the best results come from transparency, sharing knowledge and commitment to the highest standards. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do. By combining cutting-edge AI technologies with proven expertise in corporate innovation, we aim to drive transformation in our clients' businesses.

Our team is dedicated to exploring new frontiers, constantly improving our methodologies, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible, thus providing the most up-to-date solutions. With everything we do, we are committed to ethical obligations, security implications and sustainability.

Our goal is to ensure that AI serves humanity positively, contributing to a better tomorrow for everyone.

Tasks

Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of Artificial Intelligence? Join our innovative team as an AI Research Scientist, where you’ll play a crucial role in developing and implementing cutting-edge AI models and algorithms that drive the future of our technology.


Develop and implement innovative algorithms and models in the field of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.
Analyze and optimize existing AI models to improve performance and efficiency.
Conduct research to identify new AI technologies and evaluate their potential applications.
Collaborate closely with interdisciplinary teams to integrate AI solutions into existing systems and applications.
Prepare scientific publications and presentations to communicate research findings internally and externally.
Evaluate data sources and data quality to enhance model accuracy and reliability.
Develop prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility of new AI approaches.



Requirements


A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
At least three years of experience in developing and implementing AI models, particularly in deep learning and natural language processing.
Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages, with experience in AI frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Solid understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and machine learning algorithms.
Demonstrated ability to translate research into practical applications that enhance product capabilities.
Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to communicate fluently in both spoken and written English, with at least conversational proficiency in spoken German.



Benefits


Competitive Salary: Attractive, fair, and experience-based remuneration.
Flat Hierarchies: Encouragement of personal initiative and room for your own ideas.
Career Advancement: Dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional growth.
Flexible Remote Culture: Adaptability in work location and hours, supported by efficient remote working tools.
Professional Development: Ideal environment for both personal and professional growth, with access to training and mentorship programs.
Modern Technology: State-of-the-art Apple devices and software for efficient and enjoyable work.
Prime Location: Attractive office in central Stuttgart, easily accessible by public transport and with ample parking.
Vibrant Team Culture: Regular team events, a fun atmosphere, and humorous colleagues.
Social and Sustainable Responsibility: Engage in meaningful sustainability and community initiatives within the company.
Performance Recognition: Working alongside performance-oriented, highly motivated colleagues in an ambitious setting, with clear recognition of achievements.
Employee Recognition Programs: Implement programs that regularly recognize and reward employees for their hard work and achievements.



Imagine being part of a team that is closely involved in one of the most exciting and groundbreaking topics of our time – Artificial Intelligence. With us, you have a front-row seat and a unique opportunity to actively shape the future.

We are a company that doesn’t just talk the talk, but walks the walk. Our employees are passionate about what they do, and that passion is what sets us apart. We don’t just live for AI; we create it.

To help you reach your full potential and develop outstanding AI products with us, we provide all the necessary conditions. From cutting-edge technology to a supportive and inspiring work environment – you’ll find everything you need to achieve greatness here.

Does this sound like the perfect place for you? Then apply now and join us on our mission to make a lasting impact on the world through Artificial Intelligence.
Show more

  • At least three years of experience in developing and implementing AI models, particularly in deep learning and natural language processing.
  • Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages, with experience in AI frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
  • Solid understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and machine learning algorithms.
  • Demonstrated ability to translate research into practical applications that enhance product capabilities.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Ability to communicate fluently in both spoken and written English, with at least conversational proficiency in spoken German.


Benefits

  • Competitive Salary: Attractive, fair, and experience-based remuneration.
  • Flat Hierarchies: Encouragement of personal initiative and room for your own ideas.
  • Career Advancement: Dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional growth.
  • Flexible Remote Culture: Adaptability in work location and hours, supported by efficient remote working tools.
  • Professional Development: Ideal environment for both personal and professional growth, with access to training and mentorship programs.
  • Modern Technology: State-of-the-art Apple devices and software for efficient and enjoyable work.
  • Prime Location: Attractive office in central Stuttgart, easily accessible by public transport and with ample parking.
  • Vibrant Team Culture: Regular team events, a fun atmosphere, and humorous colleagues.
  • Social and Sustainable Responsibility: Engage in meaningful sustainability and community initiatives within the company.
  • Performance Recognition: Working alongside performance-oriented, highly motivated colleagues in an ambitious setting, with clear recognition of achievements.
  • Employee Recognition Programs: Implement programs that regularly recognize and reward employees for their hard work and achievements.


Imagine being part of a team that is closely involved in one of the most exciting and groundbreaking topics of our time – Artificial Intelligence. With us, you have a front-row seat and a unique opportunity to actively shape the future.

We are a company that doesn’t just talk the talk, but walks the walk. Our employees are passionate about what they do, and that passion is what sets us apart. We don’t just live for AI; we create it.

To help you reach your full potential and develop outstanding AI products with us, we provide all the necessary conditions. From cutting-edge technology to a supportive and inspiring work environment – you’ll find everything you need to achieve greatness here.

Does this sound like the perfect place for you? Then apply now and join us on our mission to make a lasting impact on the world through Artificial Intelligence.

Title: AI Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Join Our Team at Seedbox: Innovating for a Better Tomorrow

Are you ready to be part of a visionary team that's redefining the landscape of AI-driven innovation? At Seedbox, we are more than just a company; we are a dynamic force of change-makers, driven by the shared vision of our founders. Our journey began with a bold idea – to harness the untapped potential of Artificial Intelligence in transforming the German "Mittelstand," the backbone of our economy. Today, we stand as a beacon of transformation, seamlessly blending the rich heritage of corporate innovation with cutting-edge AI expertise.

Our focus is on creating AI solutions that are intuitive and seamlessly integrate with our client's business processes. Thus, our approach is deeply collaborative, from ideation to development, believing that the best results come from transparency, sharing knowledge and commitment to the highest standards. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do. By combining cutting-edge AI technologies with proven expertise in corporate innovation, we aim to drive transformation in our clients' businesses.

Our team is dedicated to exploring new frontiers, constantly improving our methodologies, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible, thus providing the most up-to-date solutions. With everything we do, we are committed to ethical obligations, security implications and sustainability.

Our goal is to ensure that AI serves humanity positively, contributing to a better tomorrow for everyone.

Tasks

Join our innovative team as an AI Engineer, where you'll be at the forefront of developing and deploying cutting-edge AI solutions. You’ll collaborate with a dynamic group of engineers, data scientists, and product developers to build intelligent systems that drive our mission forward. If you have a passion for AI and a knack for solving complex problems, we’d love to hear from you.


Design, train, and optimize machine learning and deep learning models to meet specific business needs.
Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to ensure high-quality data input for AI models.
Choose and implement the most suitable algorithms and tools based on project requirements.
Deploy AI models into production, ensuring seamless integration with existing systems and continuous monitoring post-deployment.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, product managers, and software engineers, to align AI initiatives with overall business objectives.
Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of AI models, processes, and methodologies.
Stay updated with the latest AI research and trends, experimenting with new techniques and tools to enhance our AI capabilities.
Monitor, evaluate, and improve the performance of AI systems in real-time.



Requirements


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or a related field.
At least 3 years of hands-on experience in AI, machine learning, data science, or related fields.
Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or similar, with experience in libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
In-depth understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and NLP techniques.
Solid knowledge of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and statistics.
Experience in data manipulation and processing using tools like Pandas, NumPy, or SQL.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure for AI model deployment.
Proficiency in using Git/GitHub for version control and collaborative development.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle complex AI challenges.
Ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to a variety of stakeholders.
A commitment to staying current with advancements in AI and machine learning.
You have the ability to communicate fluently in both spoken and written English.



Benefits


Competitive Salary: Attractive, fair, and experience-based remuneration.
Flat Hierarchies: Encouragement of personal initiative and room for your own ideas.
Career Advancement: Dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional growth.
Flexible Remote Culture: Adaptability in work location and hours, supported by efficient remote working tools.
Professional Development: Ideal environment for both personal and professional growth, with access to training and mentorship programs.
Modern Technology: State-of-the-art Apple devices and software for efficient and enjoyable work.
Prime Location: Attractive office in central Stuttgart, easily accessible by public transport and with ample parking.
Vibrant Team Culture: Regular team events, a fun atmosphere, and humorous colleagues.
Social and Sustainable Responsibility: Engage in meaningful sustainability and community initiatives within the company.
Performance Recognition: Working alongside performance-oriented, highly motivated colleagues in an ambitious setting, with clear recognition of achievements.
Employee Recognition Programs: Implement programs that regularly recognize and reward employees for their hard work and achievements.



Imagine being part of a team that is closely involved in one of the most exciting and groundbreaking topics of our time – Artificial Intelligence. With us, you have a front-row seat and a unique opportunity to actively shape the future.

We are a company that doesn’t just talk the talk, but walks the walk. Our employees are passionate about what they do, and that passion is what sets us apart. We don’t just live for AI; we create it.

To help you reach your full potential and develop outstanding AI products with us, we provide all the necessary conditions. From cutting-edge technology to a supportive and inspiring work environment – you’ll find everything you need to achieve greatness here.

Does this sound like the perfect place for you? Then apply now and join us on our mission to make a lasting impact on the world through Artificial Intelligence.

Title: MLOps Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Join Our Team at Seedbox: Innovating for a Better Tomorrow

Are you ready to be part of a visionary team that's redefining the landscape of AI-driven innovation? At Seedbox, we are more than just a company; we are a dynamic force of change-makers, driven by the shared vision of our founders. Our journey began with a bold idea – to harness the untapped potential of Artificial Intelligence in transforming the German "Mittelstand," the backbone of our economy. Today, we stand as a beacon of transformation, seamlessly blending the rich heritage of corporate innovation with cutting-edge AI expertise.

Our focus is on creating AI solutions that are intuitive and seamlessly integrate with our client's business processes. Thus, our approach is deeply collaborative, from ideation to development, believing that the best results come from transparency, sharing knowledge and commitment to the highest standards. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do. By combining cutting-edge AI technologies with proven expertise in corporate innovation, we aim to drive transformation in our clients' businesses.

Our team is dedicated to exploring new frontiers, constantly improving our methodologies, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible, thus providing the most up-to-date solutions. With everything we do, we are committed to ethical obligations, security implications and sustainability.

Our goal is to ensure that AI serves humanity positively, contributing to a better tomorrow for everyone.

Tasks

We are looking for an experienced ML Ops Developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining robust MLOps pipelines to ensure seamless deployment and scaling of machine learning models. You will work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to integrate ML models into production environments, ensuring they are efficient, secure, and reliable. If you have a passion for automation, scalability, and optimizing ML workflows, this role is for you.


Design, build, and maintain end-to-end MLOps pipelines for seamless deployment and operation of machine learning models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML models into production, ensuring high performance and scalability.
Implement and manage Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) processes for machine learning projects.
Monitor and optimize the performance, reliability, and scalability of ML models in production environments.
Ensure best practices for versioning, traceability, and reproducibility of models and data.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to model deployment, performance, and integration.
Implement robust monitoring, logging, and alerting mechanisms for deployed models.
Maintain and enhance security, compliance, and data privacy standards within ML workflows.
Research and evaluate new tools, technologies, and practices to improve MLOps processes.



Requirements


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
At least 3 years of professional experience in MLOps, DevOps, or related fields with a focus on machine learning models.
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
Deep understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their ML services.Expertise in containerization and orchestration technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar, specifically for ML pipelines.
Proficient in using monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) to manage ML models in production.
Strong knowledge of software development best practices, including version control (Git) and collaborative development.
Excellent problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing potential issues.Strong communication and teamwork abilities, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Ability to communicate fluently in both spoken and written English.



Benefits


Competitive Salary: Attractive, fair, and experience-based remuneration.
Flat Hierarchies: Encouragement of personal initiative and room for your own ideas.
Career Advancement: Dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional growth.
Flexible Remote Culture: Adaptability in work location and hours, supported by efficient remote working tools.
Professional Development: Ideal environment for both personal and professional growth, with access to training and mentorship programs.
Modern Technology: State-of-the-art Apple devices and software for efficient and enjoyable work.
Prime Location: Attractive office in central Stuttgart, easily accessible by public transport and with ample parking.
Vibrant Team Culture: Regular team events, a fun atmosphere, and humorous colleagues.
Social and Sustainable Responsibility: Engage in meaningful sustainability and community initiatives within the company.
Performance Recognition: Working alongside performance-oriented, highly motivated colleagues in an ambitious setting, with clear recognition of achievements.
Employee Recognition Programs: Implement programs that regularly recognize and reward employees for their hard work and achievements.



Imagine being part of a team that is closely involved in one of the most exciting and groundbreaking topics of our time – Artificial Intelligence. With us, you have a front-row seat and a unique opportunity to actively shape the future.

We are a company that doesn’t just talk the talk, but walks the walk. Our employees are passionate about what they do, and that passion is what sets us apart. We don’t just live for AI; we create it.

Title: ML & Data Engineer for Edge & Hybrid Cloud for Digital Twin (f/m/div.)
Description:
Company Description

At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Welcome to Bosch.

The grow platform GmbH is looking forward to your application!

Job Description

We make machines speak! Find out how by becoming one of our team members in Bosch’s Home of Intrapreneurs. “Bosch Digital Twin Industries” is a corporate start-up that is going global and faces huge business potential which now needs to be realized. Therefore, we need you as contributors, shapers & fellow team members in a multi-cultural, innovative and ambitious environment. Together we will take human and machine intelligence to a next level of human-machine collaboration based on learning algorithms & real-world challenges with large industrial machinery.

As an ML & Data Engineer for Bosch Digital Twin Industries (BDTI), you will be responsible for developing and implementing our digital twin solution for edge & hybrid cloud setups. This involves implementing ML & data engineering pipelines using state-of-the-art frameworks / databases and deploying them in a container-based manner using Docker / Kubernetes.


Container-Based Solutions: Design and explore IoT and cloud solutions using Docker / Kubernetes for edge-based machine learning use cases.
Data Flow Streamlining: Streamline data flow pipelines including data ingestion, storaging, deploying ML models, interfacing with cloud, connecting to backend / frontend; including the selection of ideal software technologies, databases and relevant frameworks (e.g. databases, orchestration, MLOps tools).
Cloud-Agnostic Software Solutions: Develop cloud-agnostic software solutions that can be deployed on any hardware or cloud environment with minimal modifications.
MLOps Concept Development: Develop and implement a MLOps concept tailored for digital twin solutions.


Qualifications


Education: Master's degree in computer science, data science, or a related field.
Experience and Know-How: Minimum of 3 years of experience in machine learning algorithms and frameworks, with a focus on scalable infrastructure and automation for deploying and managing ML models in production environments.
Technical Proficiency: Python, skills in relevant ML & data engineering tools / frameworks (e.g. MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow, MongoDB, time-series databases). Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift) and cloud platforms (AWS/Azure) is preferred.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with an ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Problem-solving: Strong analytical skills with a focus on delivering business value through efficient and reliable ML operations.
Languages: You are business fluent in English, other languages are welcome.


Additional Information

The contractual work location is Ludwigsburg.

You want to work remotely or part-time - we offer great opportunities for mobile working as well as different part-time models. Feel free to contact us.

Diversity and inclusion are not just trends for us but are firmly anchored in our corporate culture. Therefore, we welcome all applications, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, ethnic origin or sexual identity.

Here you get more information about Digital Twin: Digital Twin | Bosch Global Software Technologies PVT LTD (bosch-softwaretechnologies.com)

Digital Twin is a trend-setting business model innovation financed by the grow platform GmbH, the Bosch incubator platform. Get more information here: What's in it for you? | grow platform

The grow platform GmbH is looking forward to your application!

Job Description

We make machines speak! Find out how by becoming one of our team members in Bosch’s Home of Intrapreneurs. “Bosch Digital Twin Industries” is a corporate start-up that is going global and faces huge business potential which now needs to be realized. Therefore, we need you as contributors, shapers & fellow team members in a multi-cultural, innovative and ambitious environment. As an ML & Data Engineer for Bosch Digital Twin Industries (BDTI), you will be responsible for developing and implementing our digital twin solution for edge & hybrid cloud setups. Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Herausforderung

Du begeisterst dich für ML und AI und willst mit uns gemeinsam die AI unserer Kunden gestalten? Du hast Spaß daran, in einem agilen Umfeld Akzente zu setzen und AI-Use-Cases für unsere Kunden produktive Realität werden zu lassen? Use Cases, bei denen sie nicht nur staunen, sondern die ihre Produktivität wirklich steigern? Du redest nicht nur über datengetriebenes Arbeiten, sondern lebst es jeden Tag vor? - Dann passt du zu uns!

Was dich erwartet


Arbeit im Team mit Data Scientists, Data Engineers und Platform Engineers
Beratung unserer Kunden bei Data Science, AI- und Analytics-Projekten
Unterstützung unserer Kunden beim Design und Aufbau ihrer Data Science- und AI Plattformen
Implementierung von AI und Machine Learning Services in die IT-Architekturen unserer Kunden
Management von Modellen mit MLOps-Tools und Frameworks
Durchführung von Workshops und Schulungen, wie z.B. Requirements-Workshops, Toolschulungen, etc.
Unterstützung bei Vertriebsaktivitäten, wie z.B. Kundenpräsentationen, PoCs, der Erstellung von Angeboten etc.


Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit IT-Bezug, in Mathematik, Physik oder Statistik
Leidenschaft für Daten und praktische Erfahrung in AI und Softwareentwicklung, bevorzugt in den Bereichen Natural Language Processing und Deep Learning
Du bringst mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im produktiven Roll-Out von Enterprise-Scale AI, ML und LLM-Lösungen mit
Ebenso hast du Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Projekten mit Frameworks wie TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Pandas oder ähnlichen
MLOps ist für dich kein Fremdwort, sondern gelebte Realität
Python und SQL sprichst du genauso sicher wie Englisch und Deutsch - in diesen Sprachen kommunizierst du auch komplexe technische Konzepte adressatengerecht
Du hast den Willen und die Fähigkeit, die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden zu Erfolgen werden zu lassen


Interessiert?

Wir freuen uns über deine Bewerbung (PDF) mit Angabe des Gehaltswunsches und möglichem Eintrittstermin. Jetzt online in unter 4 Minuten bewerben!
Show more
